author: {'steamid': '76561199010042150', 'num_games_owned': 3874, 'num_reviews': 2454, 'playtime_forever': 200, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 200, 'last_played': 1705775437}
review:
I am 32 years old.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and we adopted our son together. Both are now 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I felt lost and unhappy. I was self-destructive. One day, I was so angry with everything spiraling out of control that I punched a concrete wall in a moment of overwhelming emotion. This resulted in breaking my fifth metacarpal in my right hand—the hand I worked with, played games with, and used to carry my children to bed—the hand I desperately needed to ensure I could continue providing.

Upon learning the severity of the self-inflicted damage, I became almost suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man, with no history of depression or anxiety. I had never experienced anger outbursts, nor was I the type to break down and cry, but I was in a tough situation that truly prevented me from seeing the light on the other side.

With nothing better to do, I looked for a game I could play WITH ONE HAND while recovering. Somehow, I stumbled upon this game and read some of the comments. I decided it was worth a try... I must admit I didn't beat the game, nor did I play as much as some of you. In fact, I may have played this game for only a day or two. That being said, after doing so, I had a new joy and hope for life. I managed to leave behind the pain and suffering that had been thrust upon me. I could experience the joy and happiness of other people. I relaxed for 5 ♥♥♥♥ minutes listening to this music, long enough to realize that I would be okay.

After realizing this, I turned off the game and went back to work. My hand hurt a lot, but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so sorry for myself and became the father I needed to be at that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving like.

Today, I am close friends with the mother of my children. We don't fight, argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents and friends.

Now I have 3 children. My third child is, wait, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my separation, and we just unexpectedly stumbled into each other's lives. We have been dating for a year and are very happy together.

Moral of the story: you never know what life has in store for you, and if I had given up when all odds were against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you.

review:
Це гра з відкритим світом на основі RPGMaker, у якій головна героїня Сура та її товариші вистежують втікача, 
щоб отримати винагороду як члени банди найманців Night Swords. Втікача схопили, а Суру присудили винагороду. 
Брат Сури Лукас вважає, що його сестра повинна звільнити землю від тиранії королеви Ліліани, 
і намагається змусити Суру очолити повстання проти Королівства.

author: {'steamid': '76561199224287509', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 68, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1671556874}
review:
Storm of Spears é um jogo indie feito no RPG Maker VX.

A história tem uma sinopse interessante e começa bem, mas acaba sendo muito apressada na parte final. Os personagens (com exceção da protagonista), são rasos e pouco desenvolvidos, porém há alguns side-quests no final onde o passado deles são mais explorado.

Gráficos são decentes (se levar em conta as limitações do RPG Maker VX e seu estilo "quadradão") e o jogo evita usar o RTP (gráficos e sons padrões da engine). Os personagens são num estilo parecido com os do RPG Maker XP ao invés de usarem o padrão chibi do RMVX. Uma coisa que não ficou muito boa foram as imagens de rostos dos personagens que aparecem nas caixas de dialogo (facesets), pois não combinam muito com o gráfico do boneco (charset) e aparentemente não faziam parte da primeira versão do jogo (dá pra notar pelas cartas colecionáveis).

No mais, Storm of Spears é um jogo de RPG Maker bem mediano, além de curto e fácil. Mas também é barato, possui conquistas fáceis e eu o considero melhor (ou menos pior) que outros jogos do mesmo desenvolvedor, como "The Chosen" (pelos gráficos e por ser um jogo completo) e "Subterra" (por ter sidequests). Fora que a história, mesmo com suas falhas, ainda é melhor do que algo genérico do tipo "sou o escolhido e tenho que derrotar o demônio com uma espada lendária".

Tem vários jogos de RPG Maker melhores, mas pelo menos para mim Storm of Spears é um jogo "legalzinho" e valeu o que foi pago. Recomendo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007343154', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 449, 'playtime_forever': 230, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 230, 'last_played': 1682374220}
review: I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single father to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and world and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

author: {'steamid': '76561198190380543', 'num_games_owned': 613, 'num_reviews': 603, 'playtime_forever': 643, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 643, 'last_played': 1673782295}
review:
Storm of Spears may be another generic RPG Maker game, however this one isn’t too bad. In fact, I actually enjoyed it. It has some original assets, a decent story, and some optional content.
The weakest part is the combat. Each party member only has a limited selection of skills, so it’s not hard to figure out what works best. Also, it’s not balanced. For example, the wizard strongest attack is the default one, making his skills useless. The game is easy overall, with only the final boss throwing a few surprises at you. At least there’re no random encounters, you can pick your battles on the field.
But other than that, it’s not too bad. You have big dungeons to explore for treasure, although some locations, like the final town, are a bit too big to travel. The sprites don’t really match the character art, and I think its because this game was originally called Vengeance Road. If you check the Steam Trading Cards, they have that title, with matching art. Those anime girls’ portraits just make no sense. They’re just there for boobs. Also, “Vengeance Road” actually makes sense for the title. No character can even equip a spear, so “Storm of Spears” is just silly. Also, the girl in the cover is nowhere to be seen.
That aside, the game is cheap, even without a sale, so is it worth your time? Well, there sure are a lot of better RPGs available, even using the RPG Maker engine. However, there are also a lot of worse ones. This one sits in the middle. It may be generic, but I enjoyed it, and it’s a cheap pick if you have nothing else to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198344257675', 'num_games_owned': 163, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 80, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 80, 'last_played': 1672181925}
review:
Классический сметанник готовится довольно просто. Главное — хорошо промазать коржи кремом и оставить их пропитываться 6–8 часов. К созданию кулинарного шедевра могут присоединиться даже маленькие повара. Ведь им обычно достаются самые большие кусочки!

Ингредиенты для коржей: 	

Мука 	2 стакана
Сахар 	1 стакан
Яйца 	4 шт.
Сметана ТМ «Рудь», 21 % 	1 стакан
Сода 	2 ч. л.
Какао-порошок 	1,5 ст. л.

Ингредиенты для крема: 
	
Сметана ТМ «Рудь», 21 % 	2 стакана
Сахар 	1 стакан 

Итак, начнем ПРИГОТОВЛЕНИЕ:

Этап № 1

Для приготовления сметанника необходимо испечь два коржа — светлый и темный. Для начала готовим светлый корж. Берем 2 яйца, добавляем к ним 0,5 стакана сахара и тщательно взбиваем.

Этап № 2

В глубокую миску выливаем 0,5 стакана сметаны, высыпаем 1 ч. л. соды и хорошо перемешиваем до тех пор, пока сметана не увеличится в объеме вдвое. После этого выливаем сметану к яичной массе и перемешиваем. Добавляем муку и слегка взбиваем тесто.

Этап № 3

Выливаем тесто в форму и выпекаем в течение 30–35 минут в духовке при 180 градусах. Корж должен хорошо пропечься, проверяем его готовность с помощью деревянной шпажки или зубочистки.

Этап № 4

Готовим темный корж по такому же рецепту. Единственное отличие — добавляем в муку 1,5 ст. л. какао-порошка. Выпекаем до готовности.

Этап № 5

Оставляем коржи остывать, готовим сметанный крем. К 2 стаканам сметаны добавляем стакан сахара и тщательно взбиваем.

Этап № 6

Коржи разрезаем вдоль, чтобы их стало вдвое больше. Начинаем собирать торт: нижний корж смазываем кремом, выкладываем второй корж и так далее. Чтобы сметанник был нежнее, смазываем кремом боковые стороны. Оставляем торт на 6–8 часов или на ночь в холодильнике, чтобы крем застыл, а коржи хорошо пропитались.

author: {'steamid': '76561199439027918', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 241, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 241, 'last_played': 1669961454}

author: {'steamid': '76561198031075431', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 488, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 488, 'last_played': 1669603556}
review:
For a short game at just around 10 hours Storm of Spears is a throwback RPG with a light story and old style combat. Don't expect anything unique or new to the genre and treat it as the throwback experience it is meant to be. It's fun but good that it ends when it does - otherwise it would feel more drawn out without having more depth.

It should also be noted that this game was also targeted by the groups who were marking games with anime art as hentai, sexual content, mature, and so on. This game is none of these things.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066346696', 'num_games_owned': 2239, 'num_reviews': 1253, 'playtime_forever': 90, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 88, 'last_played': 1665873471}
review:
Обыкновенное поделие с РПГ мейкера. Даже пытаться играть смысла нет, ибо все подобные игры одинаковы как на подбор. Единственное ради чего человек бы стал на это тратить время, так ради сюжета. Но камо-о-0-он, здесь ведь не будет приятных глазу катсценок, разве что почти полностью статичные изображения покажут и то не факт.
P.S.: в игре даже не присутствует адекватного меню с опциями, а то что она предлагает запускается в окне игры, отчего получается что мышкой там ничего не прожать, а только мудохаться на клавиатуре.

author: {'steamid': '76561198125580541', 'num_games_owned': 1206, 'num_reviews': 2050, 'playtime_forever': 370, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 351, 'last_played': 1659865116}
review:
-Cисек нету !
-Хентая нету !
-Эротики нету !
-Голых девок нету !
-Сюжета нету !
Господи, зачем я купил 4 игры RPG Makerа от "Senpai Studios", это ведь такое лютое говно..... Бесконечные ПУСТЫЕ И БЕССМЫСЛЕННЫЕ диалоги, которые игра не даст вам пропустить! Сюжет и диалоги тут унылые и скучные! "Сексуальный континент" и "игра для взрослых"= этого тоже в игре нету! Я потратил почти 6 часов своей жизни чтоб получить 100% достижений, и за это время сексуального контента я не увидел! Обычный проходняк который можно купить ради прокачки значка до 5ого уровня, и достижений. Игру не рекомендую! 2из10!

author: {'steamid': '76561198796851430', 'num_games_owned': 927, 'num_reviews': 3718, 'playtime_forever': 6417, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6417, 'last_played': 1649643449}
review:
游戏的视觉表现力不足，角色和场景的细节处理不够精细，UI设计简陋，给玩家带来视觉上的不适。这对于一款策略游戏来说，是一个重要的扣分点，因为玩家需要清晰地看到战场上的每一个细节，以便做出最佳的战略决策。

游戏中的单位平衡存在问题，一些单位过于强大，而另一些单位则显得无用，导致战斗缺乏挑战性。这种情况让游戏失去了一些策略性，因为玩家可能会选择使用一两个强大的单位来赢得战斗，而忽略了其他单位。

AI敌人的行为模式重复，缺乏策略性，敌人的行动常常可以被轻易预测，降低了游戏的挑战性和趣味性。这对于一款策略游戏来说，是一个重大的打击，因为玩家期望能够与智能的敌人进行一场紧张刺激的战斗。

游戏的战役故事平淡无奇，角色形象不够鲜明，玩家难以产生共鸣。这种情况让玩家在游戏中感到迷失，因为他们无法与游戏中的角色建立情感上的联系。

总而言之游戏未能达到我对策略游戏的期望。游戏的画面、平衡性、AI和故事情节等方面存在明显的不足。我建议玩家在购买前，要考虑好自己的期望和口味，以免像我一样感到失望。对于那些喜欢策略游戏的人来说，我建议他们选择其他更加成熟和完善的游戏，以获得更好的游戏体验。

author: {'steamid': '76561198074710940', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 471, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 471, 'last_played': 1629651753}
review:
Some Pros:
- Well paced. 
- The areas are quite large and exploration is most often rewarded with stat increasing items or equipment.
- Side quests are completely optional.

Some Cons:
- The areas can be hard to navigate without a mini-map of some sort. 
- Combat gets a little tedious. "Attack" on standard encounters with occasional healing. Paralyze, buff Attack, then whale on the "bosses". [spoiler]Unfortunately, that strategy wins every boss, so the final fight is pretty anticlimactic.[/spoiler]
- Zero replay value.

Overall: 5/10 - For the price and time invested, it met expectations.

author: {'steamid': '76561198131414661', 'num_games_owned': 212, 'num_reviews': 122, 'playtime_forever': 783, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 783, 'last_played': 1627998406}
review:
[b]CONQUER THE FORTRESS ITS NOT ENOUGH![/b]

Review : [h1]7.0 IT IS NICE GIM[/h1]

Alright, this game was fun. First of 1 minutes, it feel boring just like another RPG. You need to hunting first before going to the main story (not priority but it will make you easier to beat enemies in the main story). The story it self is pretty well, I feel like playing game with anime isekai plot. So, no doubt about the story. Which make me interest is map design. It's not to big or small, i'ts a normal map with a dungeon. Just to explore, it took much time because it feels huge than I thought. Also there is a side quests too make you help the citizen with their problem. This is why I enjoy to play this game. AFK for 2 hours, the rest is full of gameplay hours. I recommend this game who want to enjoy story in anime plot. Hunting is ez, doesn't need farming too, I farm 5k gold and its useless. Potion is a key to stay alive. A happy ending 1 party with 4 member living separatedly after all the things done. 

Cons, [strike]no nude[/strike] It's a simple battle RPG but they didn't give a health bar for enemies, [strike]too big boing[/strike] so it depends on your feelings. [strike]Sura is brocon[/strike] The character design is not look a like with the art.

Ummm, I tell you that the girl on the thumbnail art and main menu screen is gone (or never exist). Sura has a black hair and Vanesse is white, the girl on the thumbnail is blonde, so who is she? I don't know. CMIIW, You can tell me if ya know her. *smile

author: {'steamid': '76561199172366632', 'num_games_owned': 399, 'num_reviews': 98, 'playtime_forever': 274, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 274, 'last_played': 1652149009}
review:
完美通关一次游戏（做完所有的任务）的时长应该在八小时以上。
这个游戏，从RPG角度来讲，应该只能得到一般的评价。因为开的是困难难度，一开始想着可能每一场战斗都十分艰难。然后就直接接了打领主的特殊任务，还直接开了火焰领主。然后……这个领主很好打嘛。另一个特殊任务，打golath（goliath?哥利亚巨人？）也很轻松。然后就发现，精英怪比野怪还要好打，收益还高。这就很尴尬了。战斗上，到了后期也很套路。每个人物只有几个技能，而有用的就那么几个。祭祀上个aerfae light全状态buff ，剑士用tiamat（提亚玛特，混沌母神）slash输出，白骑士的辅助技能倒是有用，尤其打最终BOSS时用“最后的仪式”（忘了原名，我自己是这么翻译的）复活队友必不可少。至于老法师……除了个imbecile愚笨者降低敌方法伤，其他法术伤害还没平A伤害高。
至于装备，打精英怪掉出来的各种特殊装备能装一箩筐，完成支线任务和特殊任务也有奖励。还有就是地图里的宝箱一般也能出好装备。纯属性装备最后一个城市ironhorn商店里的是最好的。怎么选择看个人喜好，反正钱有的是。
游戏的剧情上面，讲的就是女主为弟报仇带着自己的小队加入革命军，成为主力推翻了女王的统治，然后发现是传奇法师的阴谋最后拯救世界的故事。讲道理挺简单粗暴，但是情节曲折，还是比较对我的口味的。
然后最让我印象深刻的就是游戏地图。在没有小地图的情况下，这游戏地图已经大到了令人发指的地步。尤其是有个特殊任务是去地图里面找frozen tear。就代表你需要把每个地图都翻个底朝天。翻一个野外地图大概需要半个小时。所谓十小时的主线剧情我觉得有八个小时是在找眼泪上面。最后我只找到13个，但实在记不起来还有哪两个地方没翻过只好放弃。
游戏没有中文，所以算是加了一个门槛。而从质量上来看，虽然游戏性上只能得到个一般的评价，但考虑到这游戏本身只属于加一性质，还是可以考虑玩一玩。
最后，对人物加点的小小建议。ATK全给老法师加，SPI给白骑士加，AGI加给祭司妹子。这样子才不会浪费。

author: {'steamid': '76561197995420589', 'num_games_owned': 162, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 498, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 486, 'last_played': 1612721489}
review:
Difficulty: 6/10

Pro's
- Surprisingly good music
- Fun to play
- Old school done well
- Decent story
- Won't get lost
- When you beat the game you get all the achievements! 
- Cheap Trading Cards
- Full Controller Support
- Cheap game and regularly on sale!
- Meaningful Side Quests!

Con's
- Fairly short game
- An acquired taste, meaning it may not be for everyone
- The women barely have clothes

Summary

Storm Of Spears is one of favourite old school JRPG. Buy this game! I'll even throw a video in enjoy!! (When I get around to it...)

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VG1nbhaReDg

author: {'steamid': '76561198994444754', 'num_games_owned': 56, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 285, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 284, 'last_played': 1605058863}
review:
*实际所需游戏时间长于记录在案的时间。

*本游戏为 RPG Maker VX 制品。坦白说 2016 年 6 月了还有新游戏用 VX 做我是十分惊讶的……

*游戏的五项成就随着剧情推进在你保存退出游戏后会自己动解开。

*NSFW 只是一个令人遗憾的误会，这个误会可能来源于那张封面。
-然而这张封面和游戏实际截图中立绘的差距能够很直白而深切告诉你什么叫“封面欺诈”。
-只有主角四人组有立绘的待遇，但是也只有这一张。其余的主要剧情人物只有个头像，配角就连头像也没有了。这个减号主要是给立绘稀少且画风实在不令人满意……

*游戏的剧情简单来说就是担任一个四人雇佣兵小队队长的女主角在弟弟死亡（假死）后毅然踏上了和其它有志之士造反的道路。
+故事完整，前因后果比较清晰，并且也有动情的瞬间。
-但是剧情前后展开不足，包括角色的个人剧情以及主线剧情，只是为了推进而设定，却没有多少着墨在其中，对于我这种剧情派的玩家来说还不过瘾。
*因为弟弟在身边所以不愿多向前一步，又因为弟弟的死而愤然复仇什么的。哎呀……

+?因为是雇佣兵小队，所以主角团队从一开始就定下来了。不会有更换的机会。
+主角团队分工明确，攻击的、奶的、强化的、辅助攻击的。不同角色的技能槽的名字也有所不同。
-技能稀少。升级到后期也就四个。

+主支线剧情有分开的列表。
-完成支线剧情也不见得有什么好奖励。
*可能会影响到结局其它角色的言行，这一点没有验证。

+装备多样，可以各自组合。
-加成并不高，基本上随着剧情的不断深入不断地换上新装备就对了。不必要刷，也没有装备强化的系统。

在完成了叛乱把恶王赶下台、将国家交给适当的任选后。雇佣兵小队的其他成员都因为在支线剧情里所述的原因要继续展开探寻或探险的旅程。
最后只剩下女主角和弟弟站在故事开始的地方眺望着远处的风景。

现在就只剩下你和我了，我的弟弟……
Now it's just you and me, little brother..

听起来挺不错的。
Sounds exciting.

这是我们接下来将要经历的全部。
It will be whatever we make it.

哎呀……怎么感觉这么缠绵呢……

author: {'steamid': '76561198306294318', 'num_games_owned': 467, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 721, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 721, 'last_played': 1596931782}
review:
I wanted to like this game.  There is nothing wrong with being very basic in every way.  I also liked the quest system that tells you where you were and what you were doing when you forget.  I even put up with the normal mode being easy, just to see where the story was going.  But when you offer a journal that enables you to check the boxes - and then do not change a simple directional bug (mentioned multiple times in the discussion area over years) -  it makes it impossible to check all those boxes.  So, I lost motivation, quit, and then came here to write a review.   

I don't know how to hide a spoiler and don't even know if this is one but, WARNING SPOILER  - When you get to the beach of the iceland, do everything you can right there.  You won't be able to go back to it.  Even if the glittering shows that something is still there after you leave, it only takes you back to the  nearest town, not where you landed.  You won't be able to complete two quests if you don't do it right then.

review:
I don't recommend this game.  Not because it has issues, it's just not fun.

-Pros-
The plot is dumb
You fight against mechs
The women are the main dps and use axes and swords, while in bikini armor.

-Cons-
The plot is dumb
You don't get a mech
The guys (half the team) are utterly useless.  They can literally be replace by a stack of herbs.

-Play time-
It took six and half hours to beat.  I back tracked afterwards to finish quest and found out i had missed something only available during a quest.

author: {'steamid': '76561198314614031', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1576114633}
review:
Would recommend, especially if on sale.
This was an enjoyable, little RPG-maker game well worth the cheap price featuring a straight-forward, but interesting plot and cute characters. Clocking in just under 12 hours of playtime, this game can be probably be finished in as little as 5 hours if no grinding or re-exploring of maps is done. 

Maps themselves are simple with mostly, optional encounters and familiar sprites and scenery. My only complaint here is some of them maps are large and difficult to navigate given lack of a mini-map.

The characters and world are only just barely fleshed out, but have enough substance to be intriguing if not fully satisfying. Some items were also missable if you did not explore all the locations available once you get access to the world map.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074333001', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 458, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 447, 'last_played': 1625684452}
review:
Likes:
Sura and Valesse character design.
Bought for $.49
Easy achievements

Dislikes:
Oh boy.... The battle system is straight sadness :( . Magic spells from the Warlock is pure garbage. literally, you will attack for more damage than using his spells. I also did not notice any resistant enemies anywhere in the game? Even though you find weapons that have fire/water and etcetra on it, you never see if an enemy is resistant to that elemental weapon. The games skills are very limited and you can take out anything just by buffing Sura up. The battles, even turning off the animation seems SSSSSSSOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO SLOW! Why cant your team just flash like the enemies when they attack in one place to make it quicker. instead, they have to run alllllllllllllllll the way to the enemy to attack, then walk allllllllllll the way back to there normal position.

Leveling is very bizarre. i have played games that involved visible monsters, but i have never beaten an JRPG at level 25... Even so, i never once feared i would die in the game cause it was just...basic. I was expecting to die the first time i fought one of the elemental lords like at level 4...only to kill it in a few hits? I just couldn't grasp what level i needed to be.

Dungeon design was long and tedious. Its the only reason why the game takes awhile to beat if it was not for that. The designs were okay with multiple directions to go.

The music was okay.....nothing i else i can say....it was okay.

Storyline...It was okay, it was mildly entertaining but that final battle...............................wow.........................

Overall, i would not recommend this game unless you want to get ideals in making your own rpg maker game or just want to waste a few hours of your life like i did. Easy achievements if you're into that kind of stuff and they all unlock with no issues. There is no replayability once completed the first time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198198920022', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 362, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 362, 'last_played': 1567959176}
review:
Relatively short, relatively generic and easy, yet fairly captivating little RPG about a small group of mercenaries rebelling against the great oppressive kingdom. If you're a fan of JRPG games and got a little time to spare, this is quite a nice experience, in particular considering the very modest price. There's also a little slew of side quests so you don't only have to get strung along on the main one.

+ Well written game, no typoes or such as far as I noticed.
+ Good plot and good plot twists.
+ Very nice artwork.
+ "Current quest objective" included that you can check at any time; always a good idea for people with crap memory like me.

± Game's way too easy, I didn't lose a single battle during my playthrough, even against the bosses. I faintly recall there's an option for difficulty though, so perhaps that one's on me. (I usually pick the "regular" difficulty, though...)
± Music is pretty generic. Nothing that affects the gameplay or experience though.

- Battle scenes can get tedious. There's an option to disable animations, but it can still get long-winded, especially when you're out grinding. Some sort of fast-forward button would be nice.
- Menu interface could use a tiny bit of work. My thoughts is particularly regarding when I wanted to attach a "growth" item on a character and had to select each character individually to check their stats; a "scroll through characters" option while you have the item selected would be preferable.

I believe that's it though. Solid story, got both achievements and trading cards, what more could you want from such a cheap game? Recommended for my casual JRPG enthusiasts.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085014011', 'num_games_owned': 1873, 'num_reviews': 198, 'playtime_forever': 669, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 669, 'last_played': 1566657373}
review:
[b][i]A very pleasant RPGmaker game![/i][/b]

[list]
[*]The story is actually good and will keep you hooked.
[*]Quite casual gameplay and around 10h of content.
[*]The main characters are interesting. Also they got beautiful artworks.
[*]The soundtracks are fitting and enjoyable.
[*]The map has several places to explore as well as some extra islands (you can reach them later in the game with a dragon mount).
[*]Features several main and side quests.
[*]Your exploring / questing feels rewarding.
[*]The gameplay requires only the keyboard and not the mouse.
[*][i]Plus:[/i] Steam cards + easy 100% achievements.
[/list]

[b][i]Very solid and fun game for just 0.90€. Definitely recommended![/i][/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198054688882', 'num_games_owned': 313, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 465, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 465, 'last_played': 1560085131}
review:
[b][u]DETAILED REVIEW (MINOR SPOILERS FOR SIDE QUESTS)[/u][/b]

Another game that could really benefit from a neutral kind of rating. Storm of spears is a 6-7 hour long JRPG that like many games using this retro style was made in RPG maker. I've never seen using RPG maker as a cause to instantly bash a game or believe it not worth my time and so recently decided to play through this game which I picked up on sale a while back.

As many people in reviews on these sorts of games say it appears like the RPG maker games are almost a sub-genre of game of their own and thus have a cult/niche audience that really enjoys them, I consider myself to be a part of this niche. I own a fair few RPG maker based games and so far have had relatively good experiences with them. However this game does have some problems but before that I'll list what the game does well:

[b]Pros:[/b]

-A rather nice story that has some twists and turns and shows that the person who made it did their best to put some love into it

-Nice maps that reward exploration.

-The addition of side quests was very pleasant and helped extend the games play time and make it seem less like of a quick cash grab.

-Solid if albeit very basic turn based gameplay that did what it needed to do.

-No random encounters, I myself don't mind random encounters in JRPG's but given this games very basic combat system I appreciated not constantly being forced to fight weak enemies that were basically only popping up to slow my progression and extend game time.

Now for the cons.

[b]Cons:[/b]

-The gameplay/combat was very boring more so near the end, this is mostly due to how basic it is and thus combat ends up becoming stale and repetitive. The game itself is extremely easy which doesn't aid the gameplay at all as most abilities I never used and some were not used once as the challenge never was too great as to require them. Coming to the end of the game I was basically running past fights just to fight the bosses to see the sprite design and hope for a slightly more engaging battle.

-A lot of the side quests, especially the ones on the longer side had very disappointing endings, which is to say one in particular had you on the lookout all game throughout your travels to activate obelisks to fight elemental lords and get unique weapons/armour/accessories but once I had defeated them all nothing happened, no dialogue or anything just to give the quest which seemed important, closure. a similar style quest also suffered from no closure whatsoever so I was often left feeling slightly let down and like the whole ordeal has been fruitless and of no real importance.

-Finally a much smaller gripe but some of the sounds in the game where pretty bad, most notably a cheering sound effect that played during speeches that lasted about 1.5 seconds and would be replayed with each new text box of dialogue until the rallying speech had been finished. I found this to be incredibly annoying and felt rather than aiding the speech and it's impact it instead disrupted my immersion in the story and was more of a detriment. 

[b]Final Thoughts:[/b]

Overall I had a decent time with the game, I played it start to finish and not out of a necessity but because I wanted to see it through to the end which would indicate the game must be doing some things right. However uninteresting combat that had the potential to be more engaging but fell short as it was way too easy and some corners cut on the side quests  ended up taking some of my enjoyment away from this game. I would recommend picking it up if it's on sale and if you've played other RPG maker games and have responded well to them.

[b]Verdict:[/b]

Recommended but only if it's on sale and if you respond well to the RPG maker sub-genre of JRPGs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198176475231', 'num_games_owned': 870, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 754, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 754, 'last_played': 1523955852}
review:
Storm of Spears is your standard basic dungeon crawler that you would expect to see in the days of the original NES system. Made with RPG Maker, you as the player gather your party, battle monsters, collect and upgrade armor and weapons, and complete tasks, working your way to the final boss.

The story's not bad, it's not great, it's OK. You play as Sura, a revolutionary who works to overthrow the new Queen who reigns as a dictator. Sura assembles her team and begins her quest to free the kingdom. Everything else is boilerplate and similar to any of this kind of game. The difference is that while you can complete this game in around 10 or so hours (it took me around 12.5 hours), it's not an easy 10 hours, you have to put in the effort to slog through it. Which is why only as I type this, only 6.2% of all player have actually finished it.

If you're looking for a challenge, give it a shot. At $1.99 it's worth a purchase.


Pros :

Decent story
Challenging play

Cons :

Repetitive monster battles
Supportive characters are meh


Overall Rating : 5 of 10

author: {'steamid': '76561198048810910', 'num_games_owned': 588, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 448, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 448, 'last_played': 1558565119}
review:
Overall impression: Buy when it's on sale
The Good:
+ Dungeons and areas are good mazes, but there aren't any hidden areas or surprises which would make it more exciting.
+ Decent and engaging story
+ No random encounters
+ Battles are quickly resolved
The Meh:
~ Plenty of equipment, but most of it you won't wind up using.
~ Store bought equipment can sometimes be just as powerful or more so than boss and unique monster equipment drops.
~ A decent RPG Maker game, but still pretty run-of-the-mill
The Bad:
- Repetitive and boring battles and lack of monster variety
- Short game (about seven hours to complete)
- Little or no replay value
- Felt a little bit like an unfinished beta version
- Unnecessary "soft porn" female character portraits
Note: I only collected about half of the frozen tears. (So, that was the only side-quest that I didn't complete).

Es un JRPG genérico, pero con una historia bien llevada, y un sistema de combate sencillo, pero que no esta mal.
Es algo corto (unas 4 o 5 horas), pero tiene bastantes misiones secundarias, lo que lo anima un poco más.
No nos engañemos, el juego es simple, pero cuesta sólo 0.90 € y he jugado a JRPG mucho peores que este que cuestan 5 o 6 veces mas.

review:

It was short, around 5 hours.
There was an abundance of items that had little to no value.
The characters in the main party were alright.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039971270', 'num_games_owned': 475, 'num_reviews': 112, 'playtime_forever': 641, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 641, 'last_played': 1544403403}
review:
Игра хорошая из за истории . История действительно красивая . Красота достигается за счёт музыки . Музыка мелодичная , таинственная . 

Тайна игры в том , что её сливали по два рубля в своё время , а автор поэтому же пытался купить людей слегка порнушными картинками . Картинки на самом деле обычные . 

Обычно игры этого жанра бросают геймплейный вызов хоть какой то игроку , здесь же на харде вы ни разу не проиграете . Проигрыша избежать можно банально ходя по углам и собирая экипировку в сундуках . Сундуки расставлены как призы за исследование локаций . Локации же большие , враги видимые , бои примитивно несложные . Не сложно догадаться , что игра повествовательная , а не геймплееакцентированная . 

Акцент истории упирается на добро , но сказку приятно читать , она не безыдейная , не пошлая , красивая , фэнтезийная . 

Фэнтези здесь безо всякого сексизма и это радует . Радует паладин Эдриан в бронелифчике , давно уже не встречал нормального подхода к созданию мужских персонажей . Персонажей в команде четыре - два мальчика и две девушки . Девушки , как и положено , махают двуручным оружием , носят тяжёлую броню , мальчики - лёгкие робы - платья и кастуют магию . Магия здесь , кстати , как и многие механико - ключевые элементы реализованы спорно , но в этом и не суть данной игры , как говорил выше . 

Высокое духовное начало данной концепции истории берёт всё в том же революционном архетипе . Архетип коллективного сознания рождается в братстве , а братство это [h1] 	[i]ПРОТИВ [/i] [/h1]. [h1] 	[i] ПРОТИВ [/i] [/h1], в первую очередь , эгоизма . Эгоизм же проявляется в социальной роли в виде наличия государства , в ежедневной же в виде наличия пилотки . Пилотки в Storm of Spears , как я уже упомянул - фэнтэзийной игре , - фэнтэзийные . Фэнтэзийность их проявляется в наличии созидательного "ВНЕ-"начала , а также отсутствии мракобесного , злобного эгоизма , составляющего природу женщины . Женственности в общем в персонажихах никакой , но за это и любят сказки - за художественный вымысел и приключения . Приключения в игре красивые , мистические , таинственные , мне - запомнились , игра пойдёт в избранное , хоть слегка и не доведена из за доброты сюжета , но воспоминание , впечатления , энергетику оставила после себя приятную

author: {'steamid': '76561198005439683', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 441, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 441, 'last_played': 1544310640}

author: {'steamid': '76561198095857485', 'num_games_owned': 5162, 'num_reviews': 446, 'playtime_forever': 718, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 646, 'last_played': 1540433858}
review:
Strom of Spears is a RPG maker game that is interesting in different ways.

The story follows Sura a mercenary who is trying to protect her brother from a war that a ruthless queen is leading in plans of world domination.  After certain events occur Sura takes up arms and leads a rebel group against the empire ( a typical evil empire rebel story like star wars).  During this adventure Sura and her closes friends and companions (the playable characters) go through many different ordeals in attempt to gain a army and the resouces they need to stop the empire.  The stroy is not at all bad it is just the cliche rpg story.  The story does have more interesting moments than others and it has a few plot twist.

The characters are:
SURA the main character and a dual weilding swordsman.  She uses many sword skills to attack more than once during a turn or to add status effects to her attacks. She leads the rebels against the empire.

ENDRYN is a paladin class warrior. He uses a mace/shield and holy magic (healing heath or status effects and light offensive magic).  He fights along the rebels to avenge his home and family that was taken by the empire.

VALEESE is a two handed ax warrior.  She uses buffs to enpower the team and increase there stats during battle.  She is from a mysterious race that created powerful weapons and technolgy long ago, she believes she is the last of her race and travels along the rebels to stop the evil empire and hopes to find more info about her people.

GYORG is a mage.  He uses magic that damages many enemies at once and can cause neg. statuses to them as well.  He fights against the empire because they tricked his family and stole all his wealth and home from him.
The cast has interesting background stories and each has a side quest that gives more info on them.

The combat:
Its a basic turn based rpg, where the characters can attack use magic/skills or items during battle.  The game seems a little broken and easy when it came to the combat.  Sura was great at attacking while valeese who also had high attack stat did not do that much damage (so she was better buffing up Sura attack even higher).  Endryn was great for healing the teams HP and attacking when health was high. Gyorg was the most broken......he is a mage class yet high magic barely did any damage....when he would simply attack he could possibly do more damage that Endryn and sometimes Valeese. So i rarely used his magic.

The game had many cool side missions that could be completed for money and loot...but after a certain point the rewards gained from these quest seemed pointless.  The weapon/armor shops seemed pointless after the begining because you would find way better gear while going through the games quest and levels. The gear would drastically increase your stats so you would basically become overpowered.  

The game took me about 10 hours to complete (though i left it idle for a few hours so maybe about 7 hours).  The 5 achievements that you can earn are mostly story based so its almost impossible to miss them (though people have reported some of them being buggy).

For the Price of $1.99 you cant really go wrong picking up this title and adding it to you gaming library.  You get your moneys worth with this game for its story, combat, and side quest alone.
Though the dialogue was a bit meh and the game seemed a bit broken it is still worth a pick up.....i mean come on 2 bucks people lol.

Overall I give this game a 7/10 (recommended)

author: {'steamid': '76561198863518285', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 83, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 83, 'last_played': 1543053781}
review:
If you're looking to buy this expecting mature content and nudity, like the tags suggest... well, don't do that. Nothing here would look out of place in a T-Rated game.

I'm writing this review about 80 minutes into the game and I can say that it's grown on me pretty quick and I feel invested enough in the story to pick it up and continue playing again. The strong point in this RPG is, of course, the characters. Likeable, yet fresh-feeling characters with their own unique quirks and things to add to the story. Additionally, if you're used to just mashing through each dialogue box, you're going to miss out on some great writing!

Now let me talk about the character sprites... they're bad. Most of them don't even match the character portrait they're supposed to represent and would somebody [i]please[/i] do something about Edryan's portrait? It's just so weak compared to the others, which aren't exactly strong on their own merits either.

All that said, if you have some spare change lying around and this game is on sale, you could probably do worse.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042462454', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 114, 'playtime_forever': 258, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 241, 'last_played': 1617004745}
review:
Tja warum ist das Game Positiv Bewertet, weil fast alle Negativen gelöscht worden sind wie meins auch.
Story ist geklaut. Man läuft oft nur Blöd herum, um was zu suchen wie eine Leiter. Es wurde sich nicht bei den Charakter mühe gegeben Zb lächelt einer der Haupt Charakter bei der Beerdigung ihres Bruder den mehr kann sich nicht Null Gesichts Mimik. Vertonung besteht aus 5 Songs. Keine Map egal wo oder wann. Die Ausrüstung kann man nicht einfach sagen nim die Beste Ausrüstung. Aber was oder warum ist das Spiel für Erwachsene angeben das ist Plözin das Spiel ist für 6 Jährige denn es gibt keine wirkliche direkt sichtbare Gewalt da ist Fortnite schlimmer keine Sexuelle Handlung und es gibt auch keine sonstige unzüchtige Handlung oder Symbole. Das einzige, was das Game gut kann ist langweilig sein.Ach ja die Weibliche Person mit den blonden Haaren kommt im Game nicht vor und im Video wird eine angeschrägte Grafik gezeigt, auch die gibt es nicht.

author: {'steamid': '76561198118133248', 'num_games_owned': 344, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 262, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 262, 'last_played': 1531060690}
review:
In Short:

I enjoyed this game, nice story and a sense of achivement. You should by it!

Pros

Good Story - Easy to follow and immersive
Nice Mapping - Easy to navigate
Nice Direction - Quest journal and decent clues/cues
No Filler - Found this game very linar with all the story having a purpose
Side Quest - For you completionist
No Grinding - nough said!

Cons

Too Easy - Last boss hit me for 1 damage
Short - Not a short game just not the 10 hours promised
Achivements - They were good but, there was some good oppurtunities to use some for side quests to give extra motivation to do them. Too easy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198318190880', 'num_games_owned': 199, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 773, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 646, 'last_played': 1530656397}
review:
TL;DR 10/10 enjoyed greatly, definitely recommend if you like old rpgs Valeese best girl

Welp finished the game at around 7 hours on the in game timer, pretty sure battles don't add to the timer which is why I'd got 6 hours more than that, there's a lot of battles.

Combat:
For me it was pretty great and intuitive, 4 members that can attack, guard, or use a skill/item, one party member has magic though which I never really found a use for, was better to just make him give the enemy a wack in my opinion but every other skill was useful in some way.
Special attacks, buffs and restorative skills, a late level buff works perfectly with another late level attack so that you can deal massive damage and effectively not lose the damage from the buff caster, not sure when the buff ends or even if it does besides via death but it generally lets you win the fight in a couple of turns when you use it.
Works on a basic mp system that I'm sure you've seen before, nothing new.
There's also items that provide debuffs to the enemy but I never used them except for once before reloading a save.

Story:
It was great, was what kept me going and made me finish in just a few days, can't say much though cause I don't want to spoil anything but it's worth playing just to see the story.
There was one bit that dragged on for a long time but was mainly from me being thorough but if you play and find yourself in a bit like that just push through.

Music:
Was enjoyable for awhile but certain tracks start to wear on you after a time, there's a what I assume is a glitch that turns the music off for a bit after you sleep and I quite enjoyed that at some points but there are some really good tracks.

RPG elements:
No customisation at all, can't even choose names but it's not so bad, they have decent ones.
Leveling is pretty standard, quick at first but takes longer the higher level you are, hadn't even reached 30 by the time I finished.
Not sure what a few of the stats did and not sure if a few of the stats even did anything, didn't find ways to improve certain ones, could have even been part of the background of the screen but yeah bigger numbers = better.
There's quite a large amount of armours, weapons and accessories though I found that some of my squad would get new equipment more often than the others, not sure if I missed anything but I searched everywhere I could for side quest related stuff so would have found stuff like that I think.

I wish there was a second one(if there isn't, haven't checked yet)

author: {'steamid': '76561198111420711', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 74, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1528064783}
review:
I just could not continue playing this game. I played for 1.5 hours and the developers found the need to make every little thing a quest. There are multiple quests that you literally need to walk half the screen and talk to someone only for them to give you another quest to walk somewhere else, like your house, then give you a quest to walk back to the person you spoke to. 

Although the story did not seem too bad from what I gathered, nothing really happened in the game but silly little quests and very little combat.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013773235', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 547, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 538, 'last_played': 1528977765}
review:
Honestly, this isn't too bad of a game though it does have its flaws. You can tell it was made in RPG maker, but at least it feels like the people who made it cared. 
Graphics - Standard sprites and anime-inspired character images. The characters look nice, though the sprites don't always seem to match their portrait or image to well. I don't know why nudity is listed in the tags because I didn't see any the entire time I played it, nor were there any sexual tones to the story. Two of the characters have big breasts and revealing armor, but that's about it. Boss images look nice too.
Story - Nothing really too special here. It's all pretty cliche and is pretty predictable. Still, does a good job at telling it.
Gameplay - Pretty good. Even though I played it on hard, it was never really hard. I really enjoyed all the side quests though and it will take you a while to get through the game. I beat it in about 9 but I'd say you can get through it in about 8 if you ignore some stuff and don't explore a lot.
All in all, I'd say this is worth a buy. It's only $2, and it usually goes down to a $1 during sales. Practically free at that point. If you want a campy RPG that doesn't really do anything too special but is still an enjoyable playthrough, this one's not a bad choice.

review:
This is a rpg-maker game.
Sura, leader of the mercenary group The Night Swords, do you surrender to the might of the kingdom?
The music is ok, the story is nice enough and the characters aren't only copy pasted from every other rpg-maker game.
Some of the achievements seems to be bugged, the fights are easy as soon as you get (Viper Strike = a paralyzing move) and the music always start really loud so do not go into this game with alot of volum on.
There are badges, cards and achievements 3 that work and 2 that are bugged.
If you like inexpensive rpg-maker games with a decent story, but kinda silly names on stuff with an unchallanging fight mechanic then this might be a game for you.
Have fun, enjoy and screw you Lucas :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198293907759', 'num_games_owned': 54, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 146, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 146, 'last_played': 1492854867}
review: Storm Of Spears RPG - это довольно качественный проект жанра JRPG. В этот раз мы попадаем в мир Galager, где нам предстоит предстать в роли Суры, парня,чьего брата недавно убили по вине жестокой и несправедливой королевы. Сура становится во главу повстанцев и начинает противостоять королеве. Да,игра имеет незатейливый сюжет,однако при качественной рисовке няшных персонажей в стиле японской анимации и присутствие средненькой анимации боев - она так же имеет очень маленькую цену. 54р (каюсь,купил по скидке за 35руб. xDDD) Играя в роли Суры,мы можем проходить основной квест или же в любое время взяться на побочные квесты. Меня расстраивает только краткость сюжета (10 часов+время на второстепенные миссии) и отсутствие языковой поддержки русского. Но и без этого игра очень хороша, ведь в ней, кроме вышеперечисленных достоинств есть еще красочные достижения и коллекционные карточки, а также поддержка контроллера.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035680861', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 357, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 357, 'last_played': 1518884581}
review:
Storm Of Spears is an adventure RPG made with RPG Maker. It takes 5 hours to complete. There is a main storyline, with numerous side quests. The premise of the story is the attempt by a group of rebels to take control of their villages away from a corrupt ruler. The plot revolves heavily around the military strategy of the protagonists, and their successes and failures.

Enemies appear on the map, and can be avoided most of the time, but levelling up is necessary for the boss battles, although it doesn't take much to level up. Battles are very easy, making the large variety of items and skill upgrades mostly useless.

Side quests are not relevant to the story, and mostly come in the form of collecting all of a type of item, and defeating all of a type of monster, with an occasional NPC request to obtain an artifact from a remote location.

The story is the main draw for this game. Although the party members are not very developed as characters, the people you interact with are quite entertaining, and provide some unexpected twists in the plot.

Overall, this is a very typical RPG Maker game, and is average in every respect.

author: {'steamid': '76561198179962105', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 204, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 204, 'last_played': 1518486457}
review:
"Prepare for an epic 10 hour adventure..." 

Yeah, no. I beat this in 3, one sitting, because I had the day off.

Was it worth my time? Yes and no.

SoS is a super, SUPER simple RPG. Everything from the story to the gameplay to the presentation. Nothing will make you go, "Oh, wow." But, I have a soft spot for classic 16-bit RPGs and Warfare Studios played me like a fiddle because here I am 3 hours later having finished it. 

If you like OG RPGs and you find this on sale, pick it up knowing this is nothing special in the least. If you're not a fan and you're looking for something deep and compelling, pass on this.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992332891', 'num_games_owned': 983, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 470, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 470, 'last_played': 1517587657}
review:
I just finished the game after 7,5 hours played. 

Really hard to decide if I give thumbs up or thumbs down....

Im a big RPG Maker enthusasiast and enjoy games like this a lot, if they are well made...

Lets list up the pros and obviously why I give thumbs up in the end:

PRO:
- Characters are individuals and have their own story to tell.
- Conversations with your group of heroes and others do make sense 
   and never seem to be written to fill.
- BIG PLUS - Story is really awesome and makes fun to follow, you always want to know how it goes on. 

CON:
- Level Design is somethimes confusing, lots of dead end places and sometimes you can walk through walls or
  walk over water, walk over holes, no idea.. it feels a bit rushed sometimes. 
- Battle system is really as easy as possible, no depth. Just the casual basic rpg maker battle system. 
- Balance is my hardest CON for this game, there is no balance. Last Boss in this game does 1 dmg to my heroes with 
  his basic attack. 
  You have 4 heroes in your party, but 75% of the dmg will be made with your main character with exactly one spell. 
  The spells of your other heroes are completly useless, you can just autoattack with them, makes the most sense. 
  Your mage in the group is completly useless, he does 0 dmg. He causes 80 dmg with his most expensive magic spell.
  With an autoattack he causes 150 dmg :D 

- Biggest joke is the playtime which is written in the description of the game. 
  There it says: 10 hour playtime + 3 hours sidequests.
  I finished everything, collected everything, defeated every enemie and talked to every npc in this game.
  My gametime is 7,8 hours.... Sorry but didnt you play your game on your own when u finished it? 
  

I have seen 100 other RPG Maker games which are way better than this and those are for free, but for the small money
you can barely make anything wrong with this game.

I can recommend starting on the hardest difficulty, since normal was just as easy as hell, and this was difficulty 2 of 3...

author: {'steamid': '76561198172137709', 'num_games_owned': 550, 'num_reviews': 300, 'playtime_forever': 225, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 225, 'last_played': 1511236965}
review: 我设了个饱

author: {'steamid': '76561198356141989', 'num_games_owned': 2521, 'num_reviews': 637, 'playtime_forever': 1440, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3, 'last_played': 1517262393}
review:
Definitely a solid title, made with RPG Maker and aimed mostly at lovers of the good old retro JRPGs, with great artwork (although a little bit "standardized" if you're into RPG Maker titles) and an overall good value of the gameplay as a whole.
RPG Maker is a nice tool, which of course as a total incompetent I could not even open, but can of course become a negative issue just like when in the late '90s we used to play on tons of Ultima Online servers made with Sphere, UOL and I don't remember what else..
So, with a tool like this, you can come up with a great game if you've got skills, ideas and passion or you can put on the market a short and pointless title, as we can see everywhere on Steam. For Storm of Spears, it's definitely the first option.
The plot, as I was saying, is also interesting and quite new, you'll see lots of personality development both in your protagonist, Sura (she's a girl, not the Arabic word for the Quran chapters), and in the good and evil inhabitants of this nice game.. and in order to make a good RPG we all know that you can't limit yourself to a NES-like story of 3 hours XD
Of course, I'm not saying that this is a masterpiece. There could have been much more improvement in some areas, for example for what concerns equipment selection (we're in a quite basic "upgrade" system as you progress in the game) or spells - every member of your party, of course, will anyways have its own personality and its own abilities.
The game doesn't manage to get ever difficult, really difficult; it's great in my opinion, although it isn't an approach we had in the '90s where RPGs used to be way more difficult even if in simple settings like an 8-Bit environment; in any case, it's great since even if you are able to make money fast and to measure up to the various enemies and bosses, the general feel is that the game evolves with you (like Pokémon? XD) for what concerns enemy strength, equipment, abilities and so on.
So, you'll get through many hours of the main story and the nice side-quests and you'll always be able to confront the enemies in a turn-based combat style, quite standard, and that's what we like :)
For what concerns the worldmap anyways, there are no random encounters but rather enemies walk through the map and it will never be necessary to grind - if you'd want to, you'd have to reset an area by going out and re-enter it, just like Ys and many other series by the way, not to mention Final Fantasy XIII. But you can progress without problems during the whole story, killing the enemies on your screen and not giving much time to swipe off the same map section over and over. Even because, as I was saying, the choice of items and equipment is quite limited and there isn't the need of grinding something from particular enemies.
I saw some reviews on the character personalities and well, as I said, in my opinion every character - being him in the main party or a secondary one - has his own depth and this is definitely one of the strongest points in this game, and for what concerns the plot I'd suggest you not to overuse the skip button, since it's worth it and it will never take you much time. The side-quests too are quite short and overall probably the game will take you around 15 hours, more or less, I think more than the 10 stated by the developers anyways :)
Ok, maybe in the easy setting - I forgot to mention that there are three difficulty modes, that actually don't change that much so you can go with standard - you can beat everything in 5 or 6 hours, but it's good in a normal or even a hard side. 
And well, another thing: the game is suitable for anyone. There's no sexual or explicit content, so I really don't get what the tags are there for.. apart for some visual novel-like (or manga-like as you please) sprites of the characters, there's definitely nothing "suitable only for adults". 
Of course I wouldn't suggest this title for JRPG or RPG newcomers, since there's full of awesome titles from the '80s onwards, but if you're into this retro style and if you like turn-based combat, a simple gameplay (the four main characters, Sura included of course, are pre-made and there's not that much customization) and a good story, with responsive controls, nice soundtrack and artwork and, overall, nothing ever difficult until the end, this is definitely one of the best RPG Maker games you'll find on Steam.
Coming at less than 1€, which is probably even less in dollars, it's definitely worth the while :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198273599871', 'num_games_owned': 616, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 703, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 541, 'last_played': 1512892878}
review:
完美通关一次游戏（做完所有的任务）的时长应该在八小时以上。
这个游戏，从RPG角度来讲，应该只能得到一般的评价。因为开的是困难难度，一开始想着可能每一场战斗都十分艰难。然后就直接接了打领主的特殊任务，还直接开了火焰领主。然后……这个领主很好打嘛。另一个特殊任务，打golath（goliath?哥利亚巨人？）也很轻松。然后就发现，精英怪比野怪还要好打，收益还高。这就很尴尬了。战斗上，到了后期也很套路。每个人物只有几个技能，而有用的就那么几个。祭祀上个aerfae light全状态buff ，剑士用tiamat（提亚玛特，混沌母神）slash输出，白骑士的辅助技能倒是有用，尤其打最终BOSS时用“最后的仪式”（忘了原名，我自己是这么翻译的）复活队友必不可少。至于老法师……除了个imbecile愚笨者降低敌方法伤，其他法术伤害还没平A伤害高。
至于装备，打精英怪掉出来的各种特殊装备能装一箩筐，完成支线任务和特殊任务也有奖励。还有就是地图里的宝箱一般也能出好装备。纯属性装备最后一个城市ironhorn商店里的是最好的。怎么选择看个人喜好，反正钱有的是。
游戏的剧情上面，讲的就是女主为弟报仇带着自己的小队加入革命军，成为主力推翻了女王的统治，然后发现是传奇法师的阴谋最后拯救世界的故事。讲道理挺简单粗暴，但是情节曲折，还是比较对我的口味的。
然后最让我印象深刻的就是游戏地图。在没有小地图的情况下，这游戏地图已经大到了令人发指的地步。尤其是有个特殊任务是去地图里面找frozen tear。就代表你需要把每个地图都翻个底朝天。翻一个野外地图大概需要半个小时。所谓十小时的主线剧情我觉得有八个小时是在找眼泪上面。最后我只找到13个，但实在记不起来还有哪两个地方没翻过只好放弃。
游戏没有中文，所以算是加了一个门槛。而从质量上来看，虽然游戏性上只能得到个一般的评价，但考虑到这游戏本身只属于加一性质，还是可以考虑玩一玩。
最后，对人物加点的小小建议。ATK全给老法师加，SPI给白骑士加，AGI加给祭司妹子。这样子才不会浪费。

author: {'steamid': '76561198025265663', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 74, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 1574205004}
review:
[h1]Recommended if you can get it on sale[/h1]

This is my first attempt at a review, so I figure I might as well use this game for practice.  I'll be focusing more on design aspects than typical reviews, so keep that in mind.  Also, note that my hours played aren't accurate.  I've finished the game and complete nearly all of the side quests, but was forced to launch the game outside steam to avoid a lag problem.  (Windows 10/defender freaks out and devours CPU resources when the game is launched via steam, but not when launched directly via game.exe)

First of all, the pros:

1. It's [b]not[/b] a hentai game, although this may be a con depending on why you're looking at this game.  I guess it's just normal fashion for the women in this kingdom to walk around with their boobs nearly hanging out.

2. Great storytelling.  The developers clearly put the bulk of their focus into trying to tell the story, complete with likeable non-mary-sue characters and a few plot twists.   As someone who grew up on SNES-era RPGs, I'm used to and pretty tolerant of mangled engrish, so my expectations with jRPGs are pretty low.  This game only had a few minor grammatical mishaps, but was otherwise quite well written.  It was quite the breath of fresh air.

3. Good quest flow.  Everything was tracked and nicely documented in the quest log.  In fact, I never had a moment of wandering around, wondering "okay, where the hell do I go next?"

4. No level grinding required.  This was likely the result of an inverse difficulty curve though, so see "cons" for more info.

5. No random encounters.  The overworld is completely empty and in dungeons, enemies roam around and only fight if you run into them.  They're slow, stupid, and easily avoidable.  I want to 10/10 this game for this alone.

6. It's a fairly short, bite-sized RPG that only took me about 7 hours to complete, including nearly all sidequests.  This could also be a con I suppose, but to me, 100+ hour timehogging games get tiresome.

Now for the cons, and many of them have to do with combat:

1. Attack magic is literally never useful.  The "warlock" character does more damage with his basic attacks, which is asinine.  His only meaningful ability is a magic debuff (unless grinding his levels past 20 or so gets something I haven't seen yet) which is unfortunate.

2. The difficulty curve moves in the wrong direction.  The game starts out fairly average, but by the end, most attacks just bounce right off you, and as mentioned already, I spent no time grinding levels.  To give an idea, the last boss was only able to kill any of my characters through instant death attacks, but that was easy to counter with a revive spell or item since both of these attacks were single target and he only acts once per turn.

3. The main character is stupidly overpowered compared to the others.  By the time you get her 3-hit attack, most boss fights become trivial, 2-3 round endeavors.  To give an idea, strap-boobs has the highest natural attack power and deals about 200-250 damage with her attack.  Meanwhile, the main character's 3-hit ability does around 700-800 damage total.  Once you learn it, every boss fight is basically going to be the other 3 characters supporting the main character as she grinds the poor boss into pudding.

4. The maps are a mess.  The overworld looks like a hurricane swept through the countryside and many of the dungeons have the same problem.   The layout of the last town is especially atrocious and made me long for an exit spell.

5. The ending feels really rushed.  Despite having a nice, involving story, the end consists of flying to the final dungeon, walking inside, only to find out it's really just a tiny room.  You're immediately thrown into a short dialog, followed by the final boss fight, some dialog between the characters, and then...well that's it.  I guess I was expecting a bit more.

6. There's not really enough character development for the 3 other party members.  Each one had a personal side quest, but these side quests were really just "go to a location, interact with a thing, and that's it."  It would've been nice to see more depth and to learn more about each one.

7. There seems to be a bunch of different art styles going on here and it's kind of off-putting.  This is a common mistake in smaller-scale indie games though, so it's not too big of a deal to me.  Still, I thought it was worth mentioning.

8. The main character smells bad.  No really, she has time to sleep in the spare bed whenever you need to recovery HP/MP, but always complains about never having any time to take a bath?

9. Almost forgot:  There appears to be different damage types in the game (fire, lightning, etc) but I can't think of a single time when they actually felt relevant.

So overall, no regrets.  I got this game on sale for $0.49 and I'd say I got my money's worth.  Thanks developer, keep up the good work. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198045362376', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 125, 'last_played': 1511402558}
review:
I only hit recommend if you are seeing this for sale or as part of a bundle, it's a standard RPG maker game, the writing isn't too bad in the first 2 hours of gameplay (only played 2 hours thus far). Like most JRPGs, it's not for everyone, but if you get this on sale or part of a big bundle, you will be able to enjoy it without feeling guilty.

To be honest, the game had a different name (Vengence Road) and a different art style, both, cool. I, however, wouldn't have started playing it, if not for the anime bazongas. A total shift in art style was probably the only reason I played the game when I did. You'll see the art style it use to have if you play long enough to get trading cards.

author: {'steamid': '76561198268220220', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 430, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 427, 'last_played': 1479341915}
review:
Juego casi desconocido. Es de agradecer que haya gente que se anime en la creación de estas obras y sepa sacar partido de manera tan loable al RPG MAKER.

No obstante, no está del todo bien configurado y pronto, gracias a una serie de mecánicas no pulidas del todo, nos volvemos casi invulnerables.

La historia avanza; está cargada de tópicos, aunque trata de salirse de ellos e innovar. No es un gran juego. Tampoco es un fracaso.

Lo recomiendo por su precio y por ayudar a quienes se atreven a adentrarse en un mundo tan competitivo como el de los videojuegos. No pasará a la historia, ni te hará emocionarte, pero es sincero y no hace perder el tiempo a nadie. It´s something.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046407276', 'num_games_owned': 6090, 'num_reviews': 233, 'playtime_forever': 549, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 549, 'last_played': 1507649460}
review:
[h1]Whirlwind in the bottle[/h1]

If you shake and spin a bottle long enough you become something like a mini maelstrom, but as much as the game has to do with a storm or with spears has this little comment.

The game collected a lot of bad reviews and negative recommendations, mostly because it's made with RPG-Maker and because some people chose to use the wrong tags on the game... this happens more often recently. It's been exclaimed that the game contains nudity, and is for adults... hogwash I say. There are games that contain more nudity and are even more like a Hentai-Revival mess than this little game.

The gaming time is around eight to twelve hours to solve and finish this game, even with all sidequests. The difficulty is more or less, casual - nothing special in this matter. Story is nice, but not decent, it's JRPG staple, but the devs were very mindful, not again to pull off the "You are the Chosen One!" - trick, thanks a lot for that.

Now to give it a review or a recommendation it's a bit difficult...

[table]
[tr][th]Category[/th][th]Score[/th][th]Notes[/th][/tr]
[tr][td]Graphics[/td][td]6[/td][td]Some new Assets, some old one, looks and feels like RPG-Maker.[/td][/tr]
[tr][td]Sound[/td][td]6[/td][td]Fitting to the game, but nothing that stays in the back of your head.[/td][/tr]
[tr][td]Story[/td][td]7[/td][td]Nice, but also nothing special.[/td][/tr]
[tr][td]Playability[/td][td]5[/td][td]Has literally no replayability, but is working perfectly in my case.[/td][/tr]
[tr][td]Immersion[/td][td]3[/td][td]Here is a lack, most RPG-Maker games fail at some point to drag the player into the game.[/td][/tr]
[tr][td]Value[/td][td]7[/td][td]Intermediate, 99 Cents for a game lasting about 10 hours isn't too expensive.[/td][/tr]
[tr][td]Overall[/td][td]5,6~ rounded 6[/td][td]*[/td][/tr]
[/table]

[h1]Marginally Recommended[/h1]

Don't buy this game if you aren't responding well to RPG-Maker games, also don't buy the game if you don't like JRPGs in general, this game would be the pure toxic cyanide for you. On the other hand, if you like to experiment and play games that are considered by some people as "bad" - the devs at least try to produce something good - opposed to the whole lot of Asset flippers we nowadays find so often on Steam. This game is at least worth it's 99 cents.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027267313', 'num_games_owned': 1838, 'num_reviews': 4460, 'playtime_forever': 232, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 232, 'last_played': 1507357505}
review:
Tags: Topdown - RPGMaker & Party RPG
Additional Tags: Delete Local Content & Remove from Library

TLDR: Did not enjoy my time. Insanely generic. Limited freedcom. Epic arc feels overdone.

You get dumped right away in this cliche story. Ragtag team vs status quo kingdom/empire. Little drama here and there. Organize under some aristocrat character and get back at the man. Game tries to get all dramatic and personal at times but it was really hard for me to pretend like I cared. Assets looked pixelated when fullscreened. Game looked very stock still but with some tweaked assets perhaps, especially in the sprites. The sprites were mismatched with the VN style portraits and I found it jarring. Game keeps you stuck in instances for the greater part of the early game and when the overworld finally opens up you get no overworld encounters and get stuck going to hotspots for maps that mostly look like spiderwebs full of random spam of the same foes. It is common for enemies to have names such as Soldier A Soldier B Soldier C Soldier D. Most of the game is just figuring out which hotspot you gotta go to for the next cutscene of conversations. I got pretty far into the game just holding the attack button and ignoring all abilities but eventually that stopped working. Which incidentally is right about the time I stopped investing the effort to see how the title was turning out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198112719805', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 101, 'playtime_forever': 399, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 399, 'last_played': 1506619383}
review:
It's a nice game, nice storyline.

But not more than that. The grafic bugs are horrible (blinking items, walls that are not blocking, open roads that are blocking), many checkboxes are not properly programmed so here and there you can move around behind a wall.

That's minor upsets. Really bad is the fighting system. It is not at all sophisticated. You have magic (poison, thunder, etc.) but they are so incredibly week you are better off just attacking normally. So all you ever do is simply attack (if there are normal foes) and maybe heal. If there is a boss, you try to paralize it and then just attack. Not my idea of a fighting system to smash enter about 20 times per fight and being done with.

author: {'steamid': '76561198117124319', 'num_games_owned': 1241, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 703, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 703, 'last_played': 1484109044}
review:
[h1] Storm of Pointy Sticks RPG	[/h1]
I found no nudity, except for the skin not covered by the highly ineffective battle armors; 
[i]"I didn't even know it was tagged mature & nudity."
"You're lying"
"Who Said that O.O?"
"You're busted Fera"	[/i]             Joke aside, I got it in a bundle.

The once peaceful world of Galager has become enslaved under the rule of the cruel and unjust Queen.
Sura, the main character, leads a band of mercenaries in order to save the world. 
An unoriginal story but good RPG-maker game.

[h1] Sura's Thumb Up	[/h1]
First you need to be convinced to rebel against the evil queen, then you need to gather an army, and then you need to win. - Seems unorginal, however the story has a few pleasant plot-twists. 

I enjoyed not having to grind a million enemies to level and gear up for once. 
The enemies run around like NPC's so you can avoid boring combat. 

Cheap price, even gets on sale. 
11 hours playtime for me, which is long for such a small RPG-maker game at this price. 

Lots of sidequests, if you want to spend more time.

[h1] Evil Queen's Thumb Down	[/h1]
The characters are flat. You get to know Sura a bit, especially through her relationship with the brother, however the other characters are forgetable and you never get to know them well - with little to no character development. 

I liked not grinding, however the battlesystem is wierd. 
Mages base attack does more damage than their spells, topping it up with little elemental advantage. Basicly you only heal and stun-lock enemies. 
Meaning the game can be beaten really easily.

I don't remember if there was a minimap or not; I think I got lost a few times.

The music is boring and monotone, but mute it and watch some anime in windowed mode, or porn if you went for the adult/nudity tag and got disappointed. 

[h1] Closing Comments	[/h1]
If you like RPG-maker games, this game features all the standard mechanics, a standard storyline and the mandatory sidekicks with opposite personality traits. 
However it lacks the depth in combat system, especially in the magic area. 
Also the equipment choices seemed pointless. 

I'd give this a just below middle grade - it all depends on how much you like RPG's; because this one is mostly standard. (we'll call it classic)

author: {'steamid': '76561198277770713', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 649, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 649, 'last_played': 1503168722}
review:
bought it in an rpg bundle, took me about 11 hours to 100% it, I enjoyed it, pretty relaxing, I really liked the music. a good game if you want something for a couple of days, but not a long term investment (it wont take 20+ hours)

some small mistakes in graphics, but the kind that are funny to find, like a tree growing on someones house, or standing somewhere that you arent supposed to be.

there is no sexual content, unless you count the armour, however the girls aren't the only ones, one male character has his stomach and abs completely exposed
-female party members are strong fighters while the males are the magic users, a refreshing break from the typical girls are mages rpgs
-while there was some predictability there were still some surprises that completely caught me off guard

author: {'steamid': '76561197982293787', 'num_games_owned': 2327, 'num_reviews': 160, 'playtime_forever': 518, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 518, 'last_played': 1502048470}
review:
First off, this game is oddly labled with sexual content and nudity tags. But there isn't anything that would qualify as either. The women do wear ridiculously ineffective video game armor, but that's it. So if that was what you were looking for, go elsewhere, and if you were worried you'd be jumping into an eroge game, don't worry.

That aside, This game is pretty okay. The story is rather generic and the combat is old school, but there's nothing wrong with that. There's a few things to nitpick about, some levels have bridges you can't walk under, some of the portraits don't look much like the sprites, advancement is easy, you get flush with gold quickly and while there's a fair amount of equipment, there aren't a lot of difficult choices to make when outfitting your gear. More variety in that department, and in spell selection would've gone a long way. 

But for the price they're asking, you get a solid old school generic RPG with hours of gameplay. That's hard to complain about. And if that is what you're looking for, I can recommend this game.

review:
Pros: Short, good amount of side-quests, good amount of achievements, well-made graphics.

Cons: Unoriginal and repetitive music, inconsistent character designs, no character development, offensive magic is useless, elemental attributes on weapons are also useless, some of the dialogue requires walking back and forth between rooms.

In short, a typical RPG-maker game.

review: Storm of Spears is an epic, carefully made experience that any devotee of good RPG's would appreciate. The enamoring story will direct you into the universe while the overall balanced fights will keep you playing until the end. Regardless of the missions being from time to time hard to investigate, Storm of Spears is a game that has something for everybody. Did I say that you ride around on a legendary serpent? No doubt, you get the chance to do that too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042620952', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1382, 'playtime_forever': 539, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 509, 'last_played': 1497131572}
review:
[h1] Genre [/h1] Ein Old School JRPG

[h1] Story [/h1] Wir spielen eine Gruppe von Söldnern die sich "Night Swords" nennen und hier und dort immer mal wieder Aufträge annehmen. Als dann aber plötzlich eine Rebellion ausbricht und es zu einem Schicksalsschlag für unseren Haupt Charakter "Sura" kommt, schwört Sie Rache und will das Königreich stürzen

[h1] Gameplay [/h1] Es gibt die typischen Rundenbasierte Kämpfe wie man es gewohnt ist. Wir haben 4 Charaktere mit Unterschiedlichen Fähigkeiten, Stärken & Schwächen. Die Magie ist in diesem Spiel Leider komplett Nutzlos. Der Magier macht mit Normalen Attacken viel mehr Schaden als mit Magie 

[h1] Achievements [/h1] Es gibt insgesamt 5 Erfolge. Diese gibt es alle automatisch während des durchspielens

[h1] Pro/Contra [/h1]
+ Gute Story
+ Gute Charaktere
+ Gute Musik
+ Überraschende Wendungen
+ Achievements
+ Sammelkarten
+ XBox 360 Controller Support

- Magie ist Nutzlos (selbst der Magier macht mehr Schaden mit normalen Angriffen)

[h1] Fazit [/h1] Ein richtig Gutes und Empfehlenswertes Old School JRPG. Die Story ist gelungen und die Charaktere sind Sympathisch. Für Fans von RPGMaker JRPGs und/oder Achievement Hunter sehr zu Empfehlen
