review: This is an awesome RPG; like the SNES games. This time I got everything in the game done , but 1 Frozen Tear out of 15. I recommend this game to an & all RPG lovers out there. This game is more than I paid for it. I can wait to play it again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198311636099', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 652, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 652, 'last_played': 1469302680}
review:
Very lovely RPG game for those who like this style of RPG's. Good story, nice music, easy turn-based combat. Downside is that it is short, the end coming to quick, even when doing side-quests. A second minor point is the magic of the warlock character : you're better off with physical attacks then using magical spells since the physical attacks do way more damage toward enemies while the minor damage coming from spells is kinda of a joke.  
There is no nudity in this game at all, so even kids could play this game without having their parents to be worried. In phantasy games, ladies are always lovely dressed but this is miles away from what can be defined as 'nudity'. Certainly in this game. No vulgarities or things that could be classified as adult content.
The range of items (equipment, potions, weapons) are ok, considering this is a short RPG game. There are 3 difficulty modes to play 'Storm of Spears'. I played in 'normal' mode but it felt like playing in 'easy' mode so I guess one could even start this game in 'hard' mode without much troubles to finish the game.

As player, you cannot create your own characters in this game but receive 4 premade characters. Depending on your taste, this could be either a positive or negative point. I loved the characters because of the good story, their personality and background. An improvement would be if it was possible to give at least names to the characters yourself. The names are also premade.

Conclusion: the game is worth its cheap price. Decent in its totality but short, having its bonuses and its cons. But every game, even the very best have their bonuses and cons. No game is perfect in the same way no human is perfect :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198018576932', 'num_games_owned': 697, 'num_reviews': 184, 'playtime_forever': 297, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 297, 'last_played': 1469201781}
review:
Et bien, ce jeu a été pour moi une excellente surprise. Dans un premier temps, un compte Steam inconnu au nom de 'EQ Free Games' m'ajoute : septique, je décide finalement d'accepter la requête et voyant qu'il n'y a pas de discussion engagée, je finis par oublier son existence.
Puis un beau jour, je reçois un message de compte qui me présente ce jeu, avec la clé CD à activer. Naturellement je sens le fake mais finalement la clé CD fonctionne et Storm of Spears apparaît dans ma bibliothèque.

Que dire à son sujet ? Graphiquement c'est dans un style old school, type Game Boy Advance, avec des textures certes datées mais qui m'ont donné la nostalgie de ma première console. L'histoire met en oeuvre un groupe de 4 mercenaires aux 'classes' classiques, à savoir  'Swordsinger', 'Warrior', 'Monk' ( le soigneur de l'équipe ) et le 'Warlock'. Si toutefois les origines des personnages restent dans un premier temps inconnues, des quêtes secondaires permettront d'en apprendre plus sur chacun et ainsi permettre à la fin du jeu de présager une suite.

Niveau scénario, c'est complet, on assiste à un dénouement final entremêlé d'éléments classiques du RPG japonais : le fameux royaume, les trahisons, la magie et des héros déchus. Effectuer la trame principale et quelques quêtes secondaires demande environ 5h, plus pour finir le jeu à 100%.

Qu'est-ce qui m'a plu ? L'ambiance héroic fantasy dans un style Game Boy ainsi que le système de combat à la Final Fantasy, avec du combat au tour par tour ; en fait le système & l'interface sont exactement identiques. La musique renforce également l'univers, autant dans les moments épiques que tragiques.

Bref, un bon jeu qui occupe pendant quelques heures, avec une histoire intéressante et complète. On notera les autres quêtes secondaires qui rallongent la durée de vie.

Points négatifs cependant : jeu uniquement disponible en anglais. En soit ce n'est pas dérangeant pour la plupart des gens, mais certains pourraient être découragés d'explorer ce jeu. Autre point noir du jeu, l'apparence des personnages : dans les quelques dialogues ou images du jeu fournis sur la page Steam, ce qui saute aux yeux ce sont bien les 2 héroïnes dans des tenues assez légères. Regrettable erreur de marketing, car l'essence du jeu est à des années lumière de ces images suggestives.

Je le recommande donc vu son faible prix, pour son histoire & son côté old school.

author: {'steamid': '76561198115602423', 'num_games_owned': 384, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 430, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 430, 'last_played': 1466584143}
review:
Storm Of Spears is a RPGMaker created role-playing game with a very misleading title. There are other aspects of this game that may be misleading to players.

To start, the game's performance is below standards to play. Regardless of your system, the game will most likely stay at below 30FPS.  The game also runs an outdated version of RPGMaker (VXAce) instead of its current sucessor (MV). From the looks of it, SoS went through little time in development, so a simple switch to a better game creator version would have seriously improved its asthetics, performance and even resolution.

The design and visuals is simply inconsistent. The main character, Sura, has 3 different depictions of her; bust image, ingame sprite and trading card artwork. All 3 are very unrecognizable from each other. Also, the false and unrealistic breast sizes. This game has a "Nudity" tag and after completing the whole game, I recieved not a nipple. Nothing more than a clickbait tag. The story is decent, but mostly textbook. Also, there are many plot twists, expected and unexpected. A common trend to keep the story somewhat interesting. The battle system is stock. You have your 4 by the book retro RPG character lineup (Attacker, Stat Changer, White Magic, Black Magic). The sidequests are meaningless and the achievements are so simple to get. Just "play" through the main game.

Overall, Storm of Spears NEEDS a huge overhaul. Program update, custom asthetics, consistent character portraits and sprites, better story telling, alternate battle system beyond the stock, sidequests with high risk; high reward, and a name change. 

Rating: 4.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198001695179', 'num_games_owned': 1857, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 379, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 379, 'last_played': 1468754842}
review:
All in all, for an RPG Maker game, while it is in no way a standout title, I found it quite entertaining, with a story that reminded me of the Suikoden franchise.  I started playing, and continued to do so until I realized I beat the game in around 5-6 hours, which of late is an impressive feat as my attention hasn't been that easy for a game to keep.  The story is decent, with some good plot points, but not much to the story as the total playtime would imply.  The art for the main characters is well drawn, although I did feel a little curious at the random blonde on the title screen that had nothing to do with the story whatsoever.  Fight mechanics are simple enough, with no random encounters, so any fighting done involves running into various mobs on the map.  I did find it disappointing that magical attacking never did the damage my mage could do with simple melee, which made the character feel kind of pointless.  I found the music to be somewhat forgettable, so I opted to listen to my own music as there was no need to hear the game.

For the most part, the game felt like a decent attempt at creating a short RPG with some quality from the SNES era, and did so well.  For it's normal $2 price, I'd recommended it without reservation, and even then with Steam's bundle discounts it can easily be bought for quite a bit less.

author: {'steamid': '76561197962094554', 'num_games_owned': 632, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 320, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 320, 'last_played': 1468132761}
review:
This game is a decidedly mixed bag.  On one hand, the story is very well told.  You can tell a lot of time and effort was put into it.  On the other hand, even for a RPGMaker game, it is technically unimpressive;  Sprites, music and sounds are stock RPGMaker assets, which cheapens the production values considerably.  The hand-drawn art is gorgeous, but all-too-often, it doesn't match the character's sprite it's supposed to represent.  A pretty guy with white hair as a portrait becomes a mustachioed guy with a huge chin as a sprite, for example.  Also, the art for the main characters doesn't change to express emotion, leaving for inappropriate smiling during sad moments.  It's a pity the effort that went into story and art apparently didn't reach the rest of the game.

Also, unless this is like your first RPG ever, do NOT play it on normal difficulty.  The game was so easy that the gameplay became rather tedious to get through in order to get to the story.  I'm not sure how well the harder difficulties scale it up, but the normal setting at least shows a decided lack of balance, unless "Normal" was a setting that was intended for casual players, in which case it should be named "Casual" or "Easy".

All and all, though... for the couple of bucks it goes for, it might be work a look, if only for its story and art.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097859399', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 290, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 290, 'last_played': 1468081130}
review:
Pros:

Hardly any grinding for levels 
story was pretty good
fighting was very easy
enemies are easy to bypass if you do not want to fight
Game of Thrones references
big anime tiddies

Cons:

Characters did not look like their models
story was very predictable and linear 
no map system of any kind
enemies health is not displayed
dragon has a hard time finding a place to land
small anime tiddies
no quest tracker 

I definitely recommend this game just because of its price tag of $1.99. It was a nice change of pace from other games I play. I put nearly 5 hours into this game doing as many side quests as I could. It was hard to locate certain quest starting points due to no map system. The easiest way to defeat bosses and Golaths is use Sura's viper bite, keep your party healed with the white robe guy (cant remember his name), use Valesee's strength buff or alfare light buff on Sura and herself, then just keep attacking with Sura's sword techniques and Valesee's normal attack. You will win every battle ever. 

Overall it is a nice way to waste time if you don't feel like committing a long time to a game, but it will get old and boring if you play too long. 

I give the game a 6/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076660101', 'num_games_owned': 132, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 354, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 354, 'last_played': 1467784680}
review:
Excellent little RPG Maker game. Fully recommend it to anyone who wants something different for a change, a break from the AAA titles. I got right into it, sure the story telling is pretty cliche but they pulled it off quite well. There were very few bugs I ran into, to be expected that there'd be some. Nothing game breaking, most people won't even notice, all the ones I ran into were by accident. (like walking in areas you shouldn't be able to walk in). There was one zone that was really choppy for me (Bruske Mines, the Phantom area). I don't know why, but that was the only zone I had issues with.

As far as RPG Maker goes, this one has been the best I've tried so far. I got this as part of a bundle and it's certainly much better than some of the others that came with the bundle.

Idk if the developers read these reviews, if they do. I'd like to share some of my thoughts on this game and how it could have been even more enjoyable for me.

- I would have liked more playable characters, create your own party from the available hereos, or a job system allowing more styles of combat than just the default
- More monster variety, I don't mind a single race of monsters specific to an area (it makes sense that monsters would kill eachother off and only the strongest remain) but if area "A" is going to have only Ogres, for example, it could have many different types of Ogres, instead of just Ogre A, Ogre B, Ogre C every fight
- I thought the battle animations were a bit long, I didn't notice it at first but towards the end of the game my inner monologue was like "damn, another fight, cmon already"
- I liked the quest tracker system, keep that up, I wouldn't even have minded if it contained less detail and the player had to find areas themselves without the "head east" hints
- I loved that the zones weren't straight lines, and if you bothered to explore an area you were rewarded with treasure or sidequest. It was always worth your time. Keep that up.
- I found the difficulty quite a bit on the easy side, even the optional content wasn't challenging, at the very least a "JRPG" game should always have one optional quest thats like "wtf is with this difficulty!!"
- Offensive magic was not worth using, I would really suggest buffing that. My "mage" was doing roughly 3x more damage with his auto attacks than his strongest spell

Maybe it's just me, but I did not find 10+ hours of gameplay and then another 3+ hours of optional content as advertized. I talked to every NPC, did every side quest (except 1), killed every monster I saw, fully explored every zone in the game, read all the dialogue and as you can see, my total game time is just shy of 6 hours. Now I don't care that it's only 6 hours in total, it was a good 6 hours spent, don't get me wrong. I know I tend to do things quicker than others but I find it hard to believe that the average person would take twice as long to do everything the game has to offer.

All that aside, I had fun, and that's what it's about. Thank you for your time and effort into making this game. I will be following you and looking forward to your future games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077147190', 'num_games_owned': 1268, 'num_reviews': 219, 'playtime_forever': 272, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 272, 'last_played': 1467493529}
review:
Ich hatte leider wenig Spaß an dem Spiel. Es ist sehr dialoglastig. Gerade am Anfang ist man lange Zeit nur damit beschäftigt, mit Leuten zu sprechen. 

Als ich dann so nach 35 min auf die Weltkarte konnte, habe ich erstmal den Tempel im Westen erkundet. Eine Beschwörung starten? Ja wieso nicht, es ist ja erst der Spielbeginn, der Tempel ist da direkt verfügbar und ich habe auch eine volle Gruppe inklusive Heiler...tja, der beschworene Gegner hat dann erstmal die ganze Gruppe in zwei Schlägen getötet. Und Autosave gibts wohl nicht. Nach dem Game Over gings jedenfalls wieder direkt zurück ins Hauptmenü.
Also alles nochmal...

Die Kämpfe nehmen insgesamt nur einen untergeordneten Teil ein. Leider gibt es auch nicht allzu viele Gegnertypen. Viele Gegner kann man links liegen lassen, da man für die Bosskämpfe nicht jeden einzelnen Erfahrungspunkt unbedingt braucht. Es reicht im Grunde, wenn Sura einen Boss abwechselnd paralysiert und mit dem Dreifachschlag auf ihn einhaut. Währenddessen macht gerade der Magier leider nicht allzu viel Schaden.

Der Grafikstil in den Kämpfen und die Charakterporträts sind Geschmackssache, jedenfalls leider nicht mein Fall. 

Nach rund 4,5 - 6 Stunden ist das Spiel dann vorbei.

author: {'steamid': '76561198173569365', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 248, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 248, 'last_played': 1467239323}
review:
Storm of Spears has all the familiar elements of a good, thrilling classic RPG (including an evil empire to rise against, a strong-willed protagonist, and mercenaries with hearts of gold). I think this game has good intentions, but it falls short of true enjoyment due to an overall unfinished/unpolished feel to it. With a little more effort, Storm of Spears could be great, but for now I feel rather neutral about it. 

I'm usually not too picky when it comes to design, but it is more than a bit confounding when the sprites in the game barely resemble the character art. The characters themselves could use more expression, considering the dialogue in game isn't horribly written by any means. But the impact of most of dialogue is lost once you see the character it is coming from always has the same grin or blank expression on their face no matter what. You can tell the creators put thought and care into the story, so I truly wish more of that thought and care would be shown in the art and design within the game.

Traversing the world map in the game was a tid bit boring, considering there were no random events or battles cropping up. You simply move from one place to the next. I also found myself getting lost quite easily in various areas (such as Daggeridge) due to the fact that most of the backgrounds were repetitive, without any unique markers to help me find my way around. This made quests rather frustrating, and this is also why I ultimately had to give up playing before reaching the end. 


Now, on to what I enjoyed. At it's heart, Storm of Spears offers fun, straightforward gameplay. There are plenty of side quests to keep you busy, if you like. The story is fine, the dialogue is nicely written with at least some character development in there. The battles are quite easy, so you definitely can't get frustrated at the difficulty unless you want more of a challenge in your RPG's. I think Storm of Spears would be a good introduction into the genre for someone unfamiliar with them, or for anyone who wants to play a simple RPG without any overly complex elements to it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037850703', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 385, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 385, 'last_played': 1467535542}
review:
I got this game in a bundle with others for like, $2~ and even then I think I paid a bit much for this game. The sprites don't match the artwork, the character on the title screen doesn't show up anywhere in the game, the plot is cliche to the point it's kinda hilarious, the battle mechanics are stupidly simple, and also broken (even on the hardest difficulty, which is a cool thing to see in an RPG to be fair, you can inflict stop on every boss in the game and cheese the fight), the assets look straight from RPG maker, and it lags. A RPG Maker game lags. I wouldn't have released this on Steam and I'm kinda curious as to how it got here in the first place. The Steam trading cards that drop from this game aren't even of the bland, forgettable characters in this game. 

I don't mind simple RPG Maker games but this really felt like zero effort was put into it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006413390', 'num_games_owned': 3172, 'num_reviews': 214, 'playtime_forever': 1010, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 515, 'last_played': 1621879465}
review:
I recently received this game for free from Free Games. It is an open-world RPGMaker-based game where the protagonist Sura and her companions hunt down a fugitive to obtain a bounty as members of the Night Swords mercenary band. The fugitive is captured and the bounty awarded to Sura. Sura's brother Lucas feels that his sister should free the land from the tyranny of Queen Lilliana and tries to get Sura to lead the rebellion against the Kingdom.

For an open-world RPG, this game is easy to finish, with an estimated playtime of 10 hours and doesn't require any grinding for experience levels or loot drops. The combat is very simple with every battle able to finish by using only normal attacks. Quest items, objects that can be interacted and entry locations are also highlighted clearly on the screen by appearing as glittering objects. All locations are small and easy to navigate, with no complex maze loops. All side-quests are short and easy to finish.

Graphics and soundtracks are decent, it would have been nice if the game allows the take screenshot button on Steam to work and mounting the dragon is more consistent as it can take a bit of walking around the dragon and pressing the interact button at each step just to be able to ride the dragon. Recommended when at discount.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046742781', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 605, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 605, 'last_played': 1467172670}
review:
Despite the multitude of flaws, I've had more fun with this game than a lot of others I've played, however I almost gave up towards the end because the flaws became so tiring. 

Let's start with visuals.  The character portraits don't match the sprites on the screen, that goes for all the characters.  The main four characters have larger portraits that don't match the art style of the smaller portraits used for other characters and there is only one picture that is used for all dialogue.  This leads to jarring instances where the character is angry or sad but their profile picture is still grinning.  

I also found that the game was very loud.  Even setting my headphones as low as they would go I had to go into the settings and lower the audio levels, however this doesn't apply to the title screen.  So when you stop and restart you get blown away by the title screen.

I probably would have still recommended the game if it was just the above issues, but it was also very laggy on larger maps (which is most of them) and desperately needed a map for several of the larger area's where it was very easy to get turned around.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019390410', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 358, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 132, 'last_played': 1590416530}
review:
I wanted to finish the game but I just can't get myself to. 

The game is boring with its stupid story line and cliche plot. 
Quests are so annoying, you have to explore the whole area to know what you're supposed to do or where you're supposed to go. 

I managed to play through quite a bit simply out of curiosity, until I'm stuck in this place called 'Phantom Vein'. The place isn't that big, I know that if I keep walking around long enough I'll eventually clear the place. 

The problem is that I lag so bad in there. It's fine in other maps but whenever I'm in there the fps is so bad that it gives me headache just walking around. After enduring for like 10 mins I just had to give up and come write this review. I wanted to try to play a little further, see where the story goes but this place just ruined it for me. 

Just don't get the game, save yourself sometime.

author: {'steamid': '76561198302238188', 'num_games_owned': 701, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 398, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 398, 'last_played': 1467110868}
review:
在一系列用rpgmaker做的地雷当中，这个算是不错了。
剧情很完整，前因后果清晰。
战斗普通难度下很简单，装备跟上的话大部分战斗不超过四回合。拣的一堆卷轴和属性药也无甚用武之地。女主套个强化攻击绝对主力，法师的法术看起来很鸡肋，伤害远不如平砍（没特意堆SPI）。困难还是不试了。。。
迷宫（并且最后的城镇也是）做的很大*_*而且越大的图越卡。不过还是能勉强躲过路上小怪。那些小怪太持盾了。
成就也是一路过主线就手到擒来了。
至于NSFW？想太多了。
吐个槽，也许该游戏的集换式卡牌才忠实地描绘了四人组的形象。

author: {'steamid': '76561198164151349', 'num_games_owned': 2681, 'num_reviews': 229, 'playtime_forever': 184, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1567858209}
review:
[h1]I wanted to like this, but [i][b]ouch, my eyes[/b][/i].[/h1]

30+ minutes into the game, I had to stop, because the graphics were killing me. The backgrounds (mainly ground tiles) are too jarring - as your character walks, they appear to "vibrate" (because of the pattern on them), and it hurts because they are too bright & loud. I was actually getting motion sickness because of the perceived vibration.

The same goes for everything else - objects, characters, etc. They are just too "clashing". 

I wish the developer had gone for a "softer" style.

[i]I never managed to make it to the purported nudity. Boohoo.[/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198063891714', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 446, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 446, 'last_played': 1466960383}
review: For the price of admission when you buy in a bundle, it's a good way to waste your time on. But that doesn't mean its a good game. An uninspired story, bland graphics, boring and unbalanced combat system, missing and unneccissary walls all kinda blend into a "meh" expereince. Take into account that the cards you get have completly different art to the main game, and it feels like the "anime girl with boobs" portraits was tacked on to generate sales. And sadly, when you bundle it with tons of other games, it works. The game is worth what spare change you could find on the sidewalk, and thankfully that's the price. Otherwise I wouldn't be giving it a recommendation. If you got some coins under the sofa cushions, feel free to buy the game (and possbily a few drinks).

author: {'steamid': '76561198165650642', 'num_games_owned': 600, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 211, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 181, 'last_played': 1466929179}
review:
*实际所需游戏时间长于记录在案的时间。

*本游戏为 RPG Maker VX 制品。坦白说 2016 年 6 月了还有新游戏用 VX 做我是十分惊讶的……

*游戏的五项成就随着剧情推进在你保存退出游戏后会自己动解开。

*NSFW 只是一个令人遗憾的误会，这个误会可能来源于那张封面。
-然而这张封面和游戏实际截图中立绘的差距能够很直白而深切告诉你什么叫[b]“封面欺诈”[/b]。
-只有主角四人组有立绘的待遇，但是也只有这一张。其余的主要剧情人物只有个头像，配角就连头像也没有了。这个减号主要是给立绘稀少且画风实在不令人满意……

*游戏的剧情简单来说就是担任一个四人雇佣兵小队队长的女主角在弟弟死亡[spoiler]假死[/spoiler]后毅然踏上了和其它有志之士造反的道路。
+故事完整，前因后果比较清晰，并且也有动情的瞬间。
-但是剧情前后展开不足，包括角色的个人剧情以及主线剧情，只是为了推进而设定，却没有多少着墨在其中，对于我这种剧情派的玩家来说还不过瘾。
*因为弟弟在身边所以不愿多向前一步，又因为弟弟的死而愤然复仇什么的。哎呀……

+?因为是雇佣兵小队，所以主角团队从一开始就定下来了。不会有更换的机会。
+主角团队分工明确，攻击的、奶的、强化的、辅助攻击的。不同角色的技能槽的名字也有所不同。
-技能稀少。升级到后期也就四个。

+主支线剧情有分开的列表。
-完成支线剧情也不见得有什么好奖励。
*可能会影响到结局其它角色的言行，这一点没有验证。

+装备多样，可以各自组合。
-加成并不高，基本上随着剧情的不断深入不断地换上新装备就对了。不必要刷，也没有装备强化的系统。

-地下城地图又大又难走。真的是大的惊人，在我有限的 RPG Maker 系游戏生涯里我应该还没见过这么大的地图……岔路一多起来根本记不住哪里走过哪里没走过。
*有一个部分需要你找绳子好攀上去推进剧情，光这条绳子就让我在地图里撞了半个多小时……

-游戏系统优化差，强制拉伸分辨率导致画质差。而且行走起来常有卡顿。而且系统占用也超出平均水平。

总评：一般，随便打打消磨时间也就算了。5软以下入包+1可以吃，全价买铁定不值。
秉持着不算太差就给推荐的原则，不给差评。

===以下结局感想，剧透注意===

[spoiler]在完成了叛乱把恶王赶下台、将国家交给适当的任选后。雇佣兵小队的其他成员都因为在支线剧情里所述的原因要继续展开探寻或探险的旅程。[/spoiler]
[spoiler]最后只剩下女主角和弟弟站在故事开始的地方眺望着远处的风景。[/spoiler]
[spoiler]现在就只剩下你和我了，我的弟弟……[/spoiler]
[spoiler]Now it's just you and me, little brother...[/spoiler]

[spoiler]听起来挺不错的。[/spoiler]
[spoiler]Sounds exciting.[/spoiler]

[spoiler]这是我们接下来将要经历的全部。[/spoiler]
[spoiler]It will be whatever we make it.[/spoiler]

[spoiler]哎呀……怎么感觉这么缠绵呢……[/spoiler]

Not that I think nudity would have made the game any better or worse as far as the enjoyment I got from it goes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198114211954', 'num_games_owned': 74, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 438, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 295, 'last_played': 1466904973}
review:
Well... What can i say about this RPG Maker game? 

It has a simple, yet hearth-warming history. You may find yourself a little attached to some character by the end of the game (but not so much); there are great "clichês" in it, but what game doesn't, nowadays????
The graphics are mostly the "standards" ones from the game engine (any "maker" would recognize them). 
The battles are simple and easy - I used the same War Cry+Tiamat Slash strategy the WHOLE game - so the game is not a challenge, after all. 

In the end, it was a short, fun and cheap game. 7/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048928107', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 515, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 515, 'last_played': 1466800614}
review: This one actually wasn't that bad. The storyline was interesting and there's a few sidequests that really make the game feel like a classic RPG. Other than a few dialog mistakes (words running off screen), and some item naming mistakes (treasure chest says I found Hunter's Goggles, but actually getting a completely different item instead), it was decent.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045164915', 'num_games_owned': 389, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 403, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 403, 'last_played': 1466372908}
review:
this game to me is the tragic sum of a lack of experience but obiously a vision behind the story and the characters,

IMO the characters are for once not stereotypes but at the same time they are introduced in about 30 seconds each in the way of akward throw away dialog, we later get some extra knowledge about the characters but the problem is we never get grow to like them, even the main character that is supposed to go through this change of heart in the first 20 minutes makes me wonder, why even bother with the brothers death (wich btw coudent be more obvious if you just stated outloud; btw this character is going to die, only to then reveal in what the dev team thinks is cleaver dialog that he actually lived), this could have been handled with just introducing the main character depressed and  alone in the wild and her firends looking for her because they are so worried, 

what im trying to sum up in this wall of text above is that we are thrown into a 4man group of characters so we already cant get to know them or care when they go through their arcs, not to mention that when sura does actually says: fuk this im going to get revenge. the problem is its presented as some sort of twist or change in her character, when its obvious that this is what its leading to, thing is that these kind of obvious stories can work if you just simply let it come naturally and dont force it while winking and telling us that "this is tottaly not whats gonna happen guys trust me".

As for another point i noticed really early is, the combat feels poorly balanced and just DULL, some of my nitpicks might be subjective but when all the characters seem to do the same damage on their basic ATTACK and not to mention that as of 7 hours in the classic blackmage still does more damage by hitting people with a staff than using thunder magic....

other small things i dislike about the combat is i feel the game should be able to come up with a more pleasing battle presentation, mostly im talking about the static movments and the fact that the battle backround is litterly just a blurred image of the current zone, and this sometimes is fine but at times it does not even cover the backof the screen.

another small last thing about the battles is the menus could have been done better by not much effort.

furthermore i dont feel like the characters stats matter, when i found a new sword for Sura i just said; oh i guess i gotta equip this. instead of; OMG YEEEEEE NEW SWORD MOFO's.

last but not least i dident need to explore for to long before i ended up in the wrong place (the bandit camp that you can acess on your way to the Daggeridge) and not only did i spend about 20-30 minutes in this camp trying to figure out where to go, but i wanted to shoot whoever made the layout, it felt like it was purpously made for you to get lost in, and once i cleared the enitre thing there was little to no reward for it, so all this frustrating back and forth in this camp was a huge waste of time, you can argue this is to make the game hard and id say, you dont need to make the maplayout seem like digdug made the pathing you should just make it difficult to actually clear the fucking floor, or like aveyond does block certain locations off with event triggers.

now you can say that me getting lost is just me being shit at the game, in wich case, how rude. but id say that adding this camp to add nothing but usless chests with consums that you end up burning through anyway, and a boss fight that is a sidequest, wich on its own is worthy of asking why would you make it feel like nothing threatens me by introducing such "Threats" according to the characters, but i can just beat the shit out of them without grinding at all and the rewards are again mediocore. but as i was saying to me this camp is missplaced and only added because the creater dident know how else to fill the game's runtime, and proceeds to link it to a road you need to take to get to a quest so that you can get sidetracked with 0 knowledge of whats going on, all this IMO just goes to prove that the world is poorly mapped out and the terrain feels like it is designed by nothing more than a novice.

I know ive been nagging on allot here but before i get flamed for honest opinions im going to say, i didnt exepct a masterpiece from a game at this price, but this is what this entire section of the page is for, to rely our opinions back to the creators and give them perspective on what was good and what was wrong so they can actually elevate their next game above this one, i really hope the makers reads what ive pointed out and if you disagree i invite you to debate me on what and why.

to sum up what i dislike and what i did like: i like that the story while being a typical "Evil queen/Rebellion" story, this one has more focus on a side i havent seen much of, a mercinary group that gets dragged into the ordeal and now has to lead abunch of retarded peasents to try and not get butcherd.

i did not like the level of skill that whent into several things like the characters pacing and the stilted nonflowing dialog, the whole brother storyline botherd me and the mentioned combat balancing and system is poorly optimised, and last but not least the fact that the map is made like someone hates me. and items overall felt like trash that i can throw around if i wanted. something minor is that the healers design felt like a joke, idc what you say that is a flatchested woman, no man dresses like this, and if they did it might have been smart to give a reason for it.

and btw using the arrowkeys and Z/X felt like i was playing a game from the 1990's...

I will recommend the game simply because we can all learn from mistakes wether they be our own or others, you just have to be able to see them as what they are.

again i mean no ill will creators ive tried making games with RPG maker and its not easy. this is all meant in the spirit of improvment by criticism, thx for reading my way to long rant about this game have a nice day ^^

author: {'steamid': '76561198004471023', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 636, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 602, 'last_played': 1466798338}
review:
Basic RPGMaker offering. I actually bought the game not knowing it was an RPGMaker game. I largely stay clear of them however, I have always been a fervent classic RPG fan. The glory days I recall so fondly. Oddly enough, this game rekindled that spark. I feel though, that that rekindling is less about the merits of the game and more about the general aesthetic of these kinds of game.

The graphics are what you see. Sprites are reused. Some attention to detail is seen in many of the zones, but, as the game presses onward narratively, you can see a distinct decline in creative attentions.

The story is what I believe the creator was  going after. They clearly had interest in the lore and characters. It does come off as general anime inspired drek though.

Very little inspiration is seen in the combat.

It is not aweful, and for the tens of cents I paid for it, you could do a whole lot worse. Still, I want to give it credit for bringing me back to the genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983828261', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 438, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 438, 'last_played': 1466663642}
review:
A simple RPG Maker game, about six hours to complete with all the sidequests done. For the money, it's pretty fun, but don't expect anything revolutionary; it's mostly stock RPG Maker sprites and tiles and a completely vanilla combat system.

The visual design is a bit all over the place; most areas seem to have been created by dragging the brush around to make a random shape, and then decorations are applied very liberally, creating rooms that are largely a jumble of different elements. The dungeon areas are quite large, perhaps a bit overly so, though the lack of random encounters prevents them from seeming agonizing -- all the encounters are visible on the map, and they don't respawn until the player exits to the world map, meaning that searching around the large, confusing dungons for secrets and treasures doesn't take positively hours.

The encounters are very easy; most mobs do nothing but attack, and even mobs with other abilities don't do anything threatening. Any given zone will contain only one or two different types of mobs, meaning that the player will have seen everything a zone has to offer in a very short amount of time.  There are many different bosses, but they're also quite easy, and, once Sura learns her "Tiamat Slash" attack, they're all dead in two turns anyhow. Except the final boss, that is. This guy has a very large pool of HP, and two different instant death attacks; the fight takes quite a while, and basically devolves into the closest thing to a "graveyard zerg" one can have in a game like this.

The characters could use a bit of work, and the Warlock Gyorg in particular; he gets a variety of attack spells, all of which are completely useless, since not only do they do less damage than Sura's attacks, they do less damage than [i]his own[/i] regular attack.

The storyline is absolutely standard JRPG "fight the evil empire" stuff, but the writing is mostly decent -- at least, right up until the end, when it develops a very bad case of ellipsisitis, and all the characters lose the ability to form coherent sentences. There also doesn't appear to be any nudity or any sex, contra the listing and the "adult content" warning; the two female party members wear revealing outfits, but that's about it. Each character also has only one facial expression -- a big, wide smile -- which seems [i]very[/i] odd when he's discussing tragic things. The logic of the world can be bizarre sometimes; it's extremely politically correct to the point of having females working in the mines,  but also tromps them about half-naked everywhere. There's also the odd moment where the party jumps off of a mountain peak, only to land, entirely unharmed, on a different continent altogether. 

Overall, [i]Storm of Spears[/i] isn't great, but it's a few hours of fun. Hard to argue with for the price, even if it doesn't contain anything resembling a storm or a spear.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054317384', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 605, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 605, 'last_played': 1466608016}
review:
Well, the story itself is good but i really hate de combat. It is very simple:

-You need no tactics to beat the monsters, even the bosses. They dont have any elemental resistances or weaknesses, so you just spam the Tiamat skill with Sura  and basic attack with the others. This works for all monsters. 100% challenging game.

-I never wiped a single combat, it is nearly impossible to lose, even in hard mode

-Final boss, just stupid. Instead of giving him some powerfull AoE or skill, they gave him an instadelete skill to one character. Awfull and pointless. You just need to have 1 character reviving each turn and made the other two dps the boss

-The side quest are too easy, they give powerfull items without any effort. I would make the "elemental lords" and the "goliath" more diffcult so the player can choose if it is worth the effort

Talking about economy i can say the gold have near 0 value. You obtain a lot and have no item to buy, they are too cheap. I would raise the price of every item in the game or reduce the gold given by the monsters.

It has some progress-blocking bugs, my recomendation is to ALWAYS do the things in the order they appear in the main quest. Not doing that can block your entire game and force you to start from zero

The good point is that is a good game for killing time and the story is interesting in some way. All characters have an interesting background and their own interest in saving the world. 

I will recommend this game ONLY by its story

author: {'steamid': '76561198065117840', 'num_games_owned': 1111, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 902, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 902, 'last_played': 1466595564}
review: Nice story, nice characters. Girls half naked, I guess it's for the manga side because if there were none, the story would be the same. The story holds the road well. The sub quests are fun. The areas to explore are long. Enough to boost the experience of the characters. Fortunately, you can play in hard mode because the monsters and boss are too easy. The weapons, protections and recovery items are not expensive. That's good, but in the end you end up with too much money that you can not use when you have all bought. I recommend this game (not the useless boobs) for fans of the genre of course!

author: {'steamid': '76561198272714162', 'num_games_owned': 297, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 571, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 520, 'last_played': 1466595465}
review:
先吐槽一下，卡牌和人物立绘的画风完全是两个极端啊！
剧情大概是推翻邪恶王国的统治的改革天命的故事。
很好的rpg，战斗难度不高，路上的敌人也完全可以避免战斗，跑路的时候麻烦少了一些。
剧情方面，充满了套路，但是我吃这一套啊（
每个人有不同的故事，有不同的性格，人物塑造还是非常不错的。有弟控，有的在战争中失去了自己的家庭，有的成为族中的最后一人，有的离开了家庭，有背叛，有忠诚。剧情还是挺让人感兴趣的。
人物立绘请让我吐槽一下Edryan的腹肌，充满了违和orz
然后让我舔舔Valeese（
稍微说点改进后会更好的地方吧
1.从龙背上下来的时候，到底什么样的地方才能正常的放下龙呢？经常是随缘哪里能下就下来。着陆地点比较迷。
2.有些地图实在是太大了，运行起来会有一些卡顿，例如IronHorn中会感到轻微的不顺畅，而在洞穴中的时候卡顿非常明显，不知道是不是地图太大的原因。

In a word, good game! I really enjoy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198312006361', 'num_games_owned': 294, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 473, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 473, 'last_played': 1466546136}
review:
I have only recently returned to PC games and Steam. I've always been a fan of RPG games and I chose to download this one to break myself back in because it reminded me of the classic RPGs I used to play on Nintendo.

I have no gripes about this game. It was fun and had a good story. Everything about the game was easy and understandable. I didn't run into any bugs because I read other reviews that talked about bugs that broke the game and avoided repeating their mistakes. Though I could see the linear problems with the haunted mansion. I went there first and only avoided completing it because I was exploring the map not working on an objective.

Considering the cost and the amount of time I dedicated and the entertainment I got out of the game I would say that I was satisfied enough to say it was a good game. Nothing amazing, not great, but enough to entertain me for a couple of hours without bogging me down.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969619144', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 660, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 660, 'last_played': 1466475291}
review:
After completeing the game, I enjoyed it for the most part. Story is slow but does explain your character and her party back story. All the side quest seem very easy to complete other than the tear drop collection. Visually and style this is a run of a mill RPG maker, but this game has had some time invested in developing it. When I play these type of games I'm often reminded that RPG maker is limited to what can actually be achived, I feel the price of this game isn't quite worth it, but would be worth it at .99 cents or less,  I had purchased this as a bundle. There are bugs in the game such as being able to walk through certain walls, but none that was game breaking to me. 

I did read one review where if you complete the haunted manor first before entering hintersol then you can break your main quest and not be able to complete the game, rather this is true or not, I would take that into mind when you reach the area. I still am happy with my purchase the only real thing I wish it had was more side quest.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097135831', 'num_games_owned': 1652, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 24, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1466405551}
review:
First Impressions:

This game is a very generic oldschool rpg with no new school updates. The game has no hd resolutions, graphical options, or mouse control. Gameplay is also generic for the genre. Despite this the game seems to actully set up it's story quickly with a decent pace. Characters are well written most of the time when there is not too much exposition crammed into the lines. Graphics are nice and colorful though the low resolution hurts the overall quality. Character art is actually pretty nice, but there seems to only be one artwork per character. Gameplay is very standard. 

For the price this game is worth it, but unless you get into the story and characters(which is possible in this one) than you probably will not like it. Despite all the negatives theres not much better on steam for 1.99 without sale. Then again you can always wait for a sale I suppose...

author: {'steamid': '76561198116940865', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 202, 'playtime_forever': 525, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 525, 'last_played': 1489629030}
review:
Acabei de dar final no jogo. Hora da análise.

O jogo é horrível. 
- O desenho da parsonagem principal é muito mal feito
- Os mapas possuem diversos glitchs
- Nenhuma das magias do mago prestam (você usa ele pra atacar com ataque normal que ele ranca quase o dobro da spell mais forte).
- A história é completamente previsível, sem surpresa, sem emoção e, muitas vezes, sem muito sentido.
- Dá pra dar final até no nível 10 sem problemas (joguei no médio).
- Os monstros se tornam ridiculamente fácei rapidamente.

Resumindo, é um jogo bem fraco, e nem comparo a grandes títulos, é fraco até memso comparado a outros indies de RPGMaker. Não recomendo (exceto se tiver em promoção de 80%+, ai vc ganha uma grana com a scartas pelo menos...).

author: {'steamid': '76561197989859778', 'num_games_owned': 1848, 'num_reviews': 228, 'playtime_forever': 394, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 394, 'last_played': 1466292558}
review:
"The title is totally misleading... not a single spear in the entire game... and not a storm in the conventional sense either."

The game is one of the many JRPG with a topdown view and a turn based combat system.

Overall it had a nice story, nothing special but still, but was way too easy on "normal" difficulty, maybe the hard one does give you a challenge.

The repeating soundtracks and lack of any voice acting (sure I know it would be really uncommon for these kind of games) made it a little hard for me to stand in one sitting, but I did it, since I was really curious how the story would perform in the end. It was worth it.

Completion time in about 6 hours with most side and special quests.

I got this game as a gift from EQ Games, thanks for that!

author: {'steamid': '76561198044469409', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 345, 'playtime_forever': 211, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 211, 'last_played': 1466249729}
review: Storm Of Spears RPG - это довольно качественный проект жанра JRPG. В этот раз мы попадаем в мир Galager, где нам предстоит предстать  в роли Суры, парня,чьего брата недавно убили по вине жестокой и несправедливой королевы. Сура становится во главу повстанцев и начинает противостоять королеве. Да,игра имеет незатейливый сюжет,однако при качественной рисовке няшных персонажей в стиле японской анимации и присутствие средненькой анимации боев - она так же имеет очень маленькую цену. 54р (каюсь,купил по скидке за 35руб. xDDD) Играя в роли Суры,мы можем проходить основной квест или же в любое время взяться на побочные квесты. Меня расстраивает только краткость сюжета (10 часов+время на второстепенные миссии) и отсутствие языковой поддержки русского. Но и без этого игра очень хороша, ведь в ней, кроме вышеперечисленных достоинств есть еще красочные достижения и коллекционные карточки, а также поддержка контроллера.

author: {'steamid': '76561198259883586', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1499233426}
review:
일단 40~50분정도 해봤는데 아직까진 일단 나쁘지 않았습니다.
그러나 아직 많은 부분을 진행하지 않았기 때문에 크게 말할 수 있는 부분은 아니지만
스토리는 별로 재미있지 않습니다. 뻔히 보이는 전개도 있고.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016096893', 'num_games_owned': 11947, 'num_reviews': 1422, 'playtime_forever': 133, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1466213721}
review:
Пошаговые RPG пользуются большой популярностью у игроков со стратегическим типом мышления. В пошаговых ролевых играх игрок развивает свой персонаж, экипирует его, а затем участвует в боях, которые проводятся по пошаговой модели. В отличие от остальных ролевых игр здесь у игрока есть время для того, чтобы тщательно продумать и спланировать атаку. 

Storm Of Spears RPG - Пошаговая RPG, более похожая на классическую, со стандартным набором функций: прокачка персонажа, яркие пошаговые бои, стандартная для таких игр музыка, звуки, графика, интересная история, за исключением, что в игру добавлены ярко прорисованные в стиле "аниме" герои с большими сиськами)

Вы будите играть за Суру, главная героиня, она лидер одной группировки, которая присоединяется к местным повстанцам, и они вместе идут накостылять злой королеве и ее брату,

В игре есть достижения, коллекционные карты, поддержка контролера, и не большая цена. 

Рекомендуется для покупки всем любителям RPG, с пошаговыми боями,

author: {'steamid': '76561198022104383', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 110, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 100, 'last_played': 1602270635}
review:
Storm Of Spears is yet another line of RPG Maker games that's made with the default sets (With the exception of the "Face" and some "Picture" sets.) Some of the music, sounds, animations, attacks, all are from the default RTP. This is yet another example of someone who,although did put some time into the "Faces", but did design their own maps, characters, and music.

The game itself isn't too bad, I have seen a LOT worse than this game. At least with this game, some of the exits and teleports are clear. (Although it still needs a little more work) There's also a few areas where sometimes the NPC's walk around in a spot where you can't get around unless you wait for a good minute or so for them to randomly walk to a spot where you can leave. (Case in point, as you leave the building at the very beginning, a dog will block your way, sure I could go around the other way, but the way I want to go is faster.)

I do like the combat system that was used, so there is that. Basic "Final Fantasy" style combat where you actually see the action. Some of the monsters are a bit original so there is also that.

I only real advice I would like to give to the devs is that the game could use a bit more "obvious" exits as it can get a bit frustrating sometimes when you been through 10 locations, only to go back to the start and you suddenly forgot where the exit to the place was.

Please keep in mind I got this as a freebe from one of the Groups I joined, so although I can't complain about this game too much, I am not going to give all "thumbs up" just because it was given to me as a gift. Understand, not complaining about "FREE", but the game needs a bit more work.

Some other things to also keep in mind...

1.) It was obviously made with RPG Maker XP, not VX or MV
2.) Graphics could have been worked on a little more
3.) From what I was told, was suppose to have mouse support, but didn't seem to work while I was playing
4.) Really? Adult content? Is this really necessary?
5.) The game sometimes has issues between full screen and windowed mode
6.) Since this was made on RPG Maker XP, this game will work the best on a Windows XP
7.) This game could have been worked on a little bit better

author: {'steamid': '76561198092573086', 'num_games_owned': 171, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 9, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1466201756}
review:
It's a good game, but not my style. I found the dialogue to be boring and the quests to be bland. Then again, I only played it for a few minutes, and I probably didn't get into the real story. 

I did, however, find that the layout of the game was nice. The music was great for the mood and setting of the game and the buildings' interiors were nicely decorated. It felt like it could be a plausible place to live in and yet the dialogue and cut scenes made it seem less natural. The character art is nice.

Once again, I'm not into these kinds of games. I never have been and I doubt I ever will be. I see potential in this game, but I am not the one to play it. 

6/10, worth your money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198297786135', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 60, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1466402838}
review:
Okay I believe that first impression reviews are always the best so I'll explain the first 10 minutes of my playthrough.

-Opens game sees boobs (Damn another Japanese game that will make me feel like a perv)
-Looks at options on title screen and sees shutdown as one of them and wonder if it will actually shut down laptop lol
-Gets into game and receives instant nostalgia boner for Pokemon and GameBoy's
-Get's into combat with Goblin having never played JRPG's before and just spams attack with everyone
-Wins and declares himself goblin king 
-Chases some poor guy to a cliff and spams a mix of poison spells and sword hits on him but he can still talk just fine in the "cutscene" afterwards 
-Quits game to write review

All in all this is definitely the kind of game that should appeal to JRPG fans and guys who don't mind minimalistic graphical presentation. As I'm a firm believer in the dollar per hour of gameplay formular $2 for a purported 10 hour game seems like a great deal. 10/10 would receive nostalgia boner and stare at anime boobs again

EDIT: I'm not sure why this is getting so many down votes if someone could let me know it would probably help any future reviews I make

author: {'steamid': '76561198026720425', 'num_games_owned': 497, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 491, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 491, 'last_played': 1466346136}
review:
Quick First Look:

In Storm of Spears the player assumes the role of Sura, a female warrior with a strong leading personality. She is leader of an infamous mercenary group called "Nightswords". After a successful mission she let's herself being talked into joining up with local rebels fighting against the kingdom, led by an evil queen, by her younger brother. When things don't go as well as expected and fate strikes our heroine hard, she decides to become a leading figure in the rebellion out of her own free will this time.
As expected the story is told in a straight forward way. It is always clear where to go to and what to do next. However, wandering of the beaten path is an option and exploration will lead to rewards.
Battle System is classic turn based with the usual command choices. The actual battles themselves are pretty simple, at least from what I have seen so far. Enemies are visible on the map and there are no random encounters. Concerning leveling up, so far defeating all visible enemies on the map is the right way to keep you characters fit for what's coming up next.

Overall, Storm of Spears is a nice RPG so far. The story is told well and keeps the player wanting to see what's happening next. Gameplay and battles are standard RPG fair and work well too. Considering the price tag, this is a sure recommendation.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010832452', 'num_games_owned': 979, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 22, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1465520018}
review:
I'm not such a big fan of RPGMaker games, just to start with.

I can't exactly say it's special, it's what you'd expect of any typical JRPG of the sort. It starts a bit slow like almost all of them do, and starts building upon a story of characters who have existed prior to you knowing them. The fact it didn't introduce the characters too much and just kinda threw me in was much nicer than having to spend an hour or so learning about them and finding party members.

It looked quite nice, although I can't exactly say the sprites reflected the character art quite as I would think mostly due to the hair. The character art was nice, although a few variations here and there would have made if more fun.

Overall I'd have to say I wouldn't bother if you aren't a fan of JRPGs but if you like that genre it's quite nice.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035383340', 'num_games_owned': 174, 'num_reviews': 243, 'playtime_forever': 363, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 108, 'last_played': 1495413548}
review: This is straight up a pretty basic simple RPG dungeon crawler. With a nice story, that actually fits the title. In the world of Gallagher ( no watermelon smashing happens here though) a Queen named Lilliana and her wizard croney Ecyphes are all evil and bad and there happens to be this rebellion going on against them. Oh and they have some elite soldiers ( the bad guys) called the Silver Claw, led by a Carwin that likes to give you problems like a bad mother in law. People aren't happy. In typical party RPG style you control a group of characters. You play as Sura, a sword singer and her mercenary band the Night Swords.  Gyorg the warlock, Edryan a white monk and Valeese the warrior. With your mercenaries you aren't involved with the rebellion, but then...SURA's BROTHER GETS KILLED. Thus Sura steps forward and with VENGEANCE ( hence the title ''Vengeance road'' ) leads the rebellion with her Night Swords. It's almost as if someone knew that she would if something happened to her brother....I smell a conspiracy !!!  Fight turn based combat against baddies of orcs, goblins and bad soldiers of the Queen. You upgrade the Night Swords and upgrade their weapons and gear. Basic stuff really.  There is quests and side quests implemented in the game to help you lv up and find cool epic loot. The side quests are not required to beat the game. The graphics seem a step up and better polished then most RPG maker like games. The music is basic and their is A LOT of story here. The dialog is rather lengthy, but you get a rather nice story from it all.  The downside is the mouse portion of the game does not seem to work. To be fixed? I don't know. There is no steam achievements, witch I always find fun to accomplish. Also to be added? The artwork seems to switch styles a lot. The store, title screen, battle scenes all have different pictures of different people and styles. Different, but with a low price and solid game with an actual story I  say get it and play through!

author: {'steamid': '76561197961412942', 'num_games_owned': 3905, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 91, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1466410777}
review:
I like it so far. Story seems cool. I haven't played it much but so far its good. I don't like the fact that I can't see the mouse and it has no gamepad options but with programs you can easily  use a gamepad. The gameplay is smooth and the script isn't filled with typos. I know its early access but can we get some different resolutions please? Gamepad support too please? 
7/10 would tell others to try it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018446175', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 565, 'playtime_forever': 372, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 289, 'last_played': 1550238849}
review:
Considering that this isn't my Genre, I got quite hooked.
I like the art style and I just can't stop staring at THEIR BOOBS.

But the game could use a better interface for the Title screen, like an Options Menu.
It is possible to set options but ingame. Also the control settings are quite complicated and you can't set your Joystick controls, only the buttons.

author: {'steamid': '76561198130202833', 'num_games_owned': 479, 'num_reviews': 98, 'playtime_forever': 51, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48, 'last_played': 1483282961}
review:
Gostei do jogo, parece bem interessante, um belo jogo para gastar várias e várias horas jogando..

Pros:
+Música boa.
+Belo design dos personagens.
+História parece boa.

Contras:
-Algumas áreas com quedas de frames, pelo menos para mim.

Recomendo o jogo!

author: {'steamid': '76561198085512184', 'num_games_owned': 648, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 14, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1465332980}
review:
disclaimer: don't like the genre, got for free, in early access (07/06/16)

my main gripes with this game are as follows: where the hell is the mouse? there is mouse control but the mouse is not visible. This is a real big issue especially when trying to access options. The mouse isn't locked to the screen or to the window so if you need to click on something near the top of the screen (say the options) good luck. 

The game mentions a map but i can't see it and i tried all the usual buttons and nothing. No mention in the options either.

The art style is what youd expect, the screen shots don't lie. Over sexulised women (coulnd't there be atleast one normal gal?)


The main characters a women which is a nice change from the norm and the tutorial didn't seem to miss anything. Really clear on where to go without being in your face which is good. 

can't comment on the music as i played muted (like i do pretty much every game).

again got this for free, and don't like the genre so for all i know this could be gods gift to jrpgs and i wouldn't know, take someone elses review into consideration before making a decision but relise these technical issues are real.
